original: gzhan yang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang / bag la nyal ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas dkris pa rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems pa gang yin pa nas sems mngon par 'du byed pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang / bag la nyal ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas dkris pa rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems pa gang yin pa nas sems mngon par 'du byed pa dang /
translated: Moreover, it is the intention that is associated with the fetters, bonds, latent afflictions, secondary afflictions, and entanglements that pertain to the formless realm, as well as the mental factors of volition,

original: yid kyi las kyi bar du sbyar te /
analyzed: yid kyi las kyi bar du sbyar te /
translated: and the mental activity of the mind.

original: 'di ni / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i sems pa lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i sems pa lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the indeterminate intention that pertains to the formless realm.

original: 'dul mchog kha lo sgyur ba @375b tshangs pa'i gsung dang ldan //
analyzed: 'dul mchog kha lo sgyur ba @375b tshangs pa'i gsung dang ldan //
translated: The supreme among charioteers, the one with the voice of Brahmā,

original: sku mdog gser 'dra kha lo sgyur ba rnams kyi mchog /
analyzed: sku mdog gser 'dra kha lo sgyur ba rnams kyi mchog /
translated: the one with a body like gold, the supreme among charioteers,

original: rnam par 'dren par mdzad pa byung ba gang yin de /
analyzed: rnam par 'dren par mdzad pa byung ba gang yin de /
translated: the one who appears as a leader,

original: 'jigs pa med par lus rnams tha dad ston par mdzad //
analyzed: 'jigs pa med par lus rnams tha dad ston par mdzad //
translated: the one who displays different bodies without fear,

original: rgyu gcig gis las rnams bsdus te /
analyzed: rgyu gcig gis las rnams bsdus te /
translated: Actions are summarized by a single cause,

original: las zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are called “actions.”

original: rgyu gnyis kyis las rnams bsdus te /
analyzed: rgyu gnyis kyis las rnams bsdus te /
translated: Actions are summarized by two causes,

original: sems pa'i las dang / ched du bsam pa'i las so //
analyzed: sems pa'i las dang / ched du bsam pa'i las so //
translated: 2. the action of resolution.

original: rgyu gsum gyis las rnams bsdus te /
analyzed: rgyu gsum gyis las rnams bsdus te /
translated: The actions are summarized by three causes:🔽1. action of the body,🔽2. action of speech,

original: lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las so //
analyzed: lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las so //
translated: 3. action of thought.

original: rgyu bzhis las rnams bsdus te /
analyzed: rgyu bzhis las rnams bsdus te /
translated: The actions are summarized by four causes:🔽1. action associated with desire,🔽2. action associated with form,🔽3. action associated with the formless,

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang / gzugs dang ldan pa dang / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa'i las so //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang / gzugs dang ldan pa dang / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa'i las so //
translated: 4. action not associated with any of these three.

original: rgyu lngas las rnams bsdus te /
analyzed: rgyu lngas las rnams bsdus te /
translated: The actions are summarized by five causes:🔽1. action to be abandoned by insight into the truth of unsatisfactoriness,🔽2. action to be abandoned by insight into the truth of the origin of unsatisfactoriness,🔽3. action to be abandoned by cultivation,🔽4. action not to be abandoned,

original: mthong bas spang par bya ba lung du bstan pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / sgom pas spang bar bya ba lung du bstan pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / spang bar bya ba ma yin pa'i las so //
analyzed: mthong bas spang par bya ba lung du bstan pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / sgom pas spang bar bya ba lung du bstan pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / spang bar bya ba ma yin pa'i las so //
translated: 5. action not determined to be abandoned or not abandoned.

original: rgyu drug gis las rnams bsdus te /
analyzed: rgyu drug gis las rnams bsdus te /
translated: The actions are summarized by six causes:

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / sgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba ma yin pa'o //🔽rgyu bdun gyis las rnams bsdus te; 'dod pa dang ldan pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / sgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / gzugs dang ldan pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / sgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / gzugs @376a *//
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / sgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba ma yin pa'o // rgyu bdun gyis las rnams bsdus te; 'dod pa dang ldan pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / sgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / gzugs dang ldan pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / sgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / gzugs @376a *//
translated: 1. to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, 2. to be abandoned by seeing the truth of the origin of suffering, 3. to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation, 4. to be abandoned by seeing the truth of the path, 5. to be abandoned by cultivation, and 6. not to be abandoned.

original: med pa dang ldan pa mthong bas spang par bya ba dang / sgom pas spang par bya ba dang / spang par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: med pa dang ldan pa mthong bas spang par bya ba dang / sgom pas spang par bya ba dang / spang par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Karma is summarized by seven causes: 1. to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering in the desire realm, 2. to be abandoned by cultivation in the desire realm, 3. to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering in the form realm, 4. to be abandoned by cultivation in the form realm, 5. to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering in the formless realm, 6. to be abandoned by cultivation in the formless realm, and 7. not to be abandoned.

original: rgyu brgyad kyis las rnams bsdus te /
analyzed: rgyu brgyad kyis las rnams bsdus te /
translated: Karma is summarized by eight causes:

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / gzugs dang ldan pa'i dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / gzugs dang ldan pa'i dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang /
translated: virtuous and neutral karma associated with the formless realm,

original: ldan pa ma yin pa'i las so //
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa'i las so //
translated: and nonassociated karma.

original: rgyu dgus las rnams bsdus te /
analyzed: rgyu dgus las rnams bsdus te /
translated: Karma is summarized by nine causes.

original: lus kyi las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / ngag gi las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / yid kyi las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang /🔽lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / ngag gi las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / yid kyi las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: Virtuous, nonvirtuous and neutral physical karma, virtuous, nonvirtuous and neutral verbal karma and virtuous, nonvirtuous and neutral mental karma.

original: rgyu bcus las rnams bsdus te /
analyzed: rgyu bcus las rnams bsdus te /
translated: Karma is summarized by ten causes.

original: lus kyi las dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / ngag gi las dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dang / mi dge ba dang lung du bstan pa dang / yid kyi las dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dang mi dge ba dang /🔽lung du ma bstan pa dang / zag pa med pa'i las so //🔽rgyu bcu gcig gis las rnams bsdus te /
analyzed: lus kyi las dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / ngag gi las dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dang / mi dge ba dang lung du bstan pa dang / yid kyi las dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / zag pa med pa'i las so // rgyu bcu gcig gis las rnams bsdus te /
translated: The virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral actions of the body, the virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral actions of speech, the virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral actions of mind,🔽and the contaminated and uncontaminated actions.🔽🔽Actions are summarized by eleven causes.🔽

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / gzugs dang ldan pa'i dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / gzugs dang ldan pa'i dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang /
translated: The virtuous, nonvirtuous and neutral karmas of body, the virtuous, nonvirtuous and neutral karmas of speech and the virtuous, nonvirtuous and neutral karmas of mind.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / gzugs @376b med pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ldan pa ma yin pa'i las so //
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / gzugs @376b med pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ldan pa ma yin pa'i las so //
translated: unobscured-indeterminate, and non-associated formative factors.

original: rgyu bcu gnyis kyis las rnams bsdus te /
analyzed: rgyu bcu gnyis kyis las rnams bsdus te /
translated: Karma is summarized by twelve causes.

original: lus kyi las kyi dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ngag gi las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang /
analyzed: lus kyi las kyi dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ngag gi las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang /
translated: There are five types of physical karma: virtuous, nonvirtuous, obscured-indeterminate, unobscured-indeterminate, and verbal karma.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / yid kyi las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //🔽bstan chos chen po chos mngon pa las /
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / yid kyi las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o // bstan chos chen po chos mngon pa las /
translated: There are five types of mental karma: virtuous, nonvirtuous, obscured-indeterminate, unobscured-indeterminate, and unobscured-indeterminate.

original: las gdags pa tshigs dang po'o ////
analyzed: las gdags pa tshigs dang po'o ////
translated: This is the first chapter on the presentation of karma in the great treatise on the levels of the great vehicle.

original: sdom ni / rtsa ba gsum dang dbye ba dang // mi dge'i las lam bcu po dang // yang na las rnams bcu yi rgyu //
analyzed: sdom ni / rtsa ba gsum dang dbye ba dang // mi dge'i las lam bcu po dang // yang na las rnams bcu yi rgyu //
translated: or else the causes of the ten actions,

original: mi dge ba ni gsum po yin //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni gsum po yin //
translated: are nonvirtuous.

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum po gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three roots of nonvirtue?

original: gsum ni / chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / zhe sdang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / gti mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: gsum ni / chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / zhe sdang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / gti mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
translated: The three are the root of nonvirtue of attachment, the root of nonvirtue of aversion, and the root of nonvirtue of delusion.

original: de la chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the root of nonvirtue of attachment?

original: smras pa / 'dod chags pa dang / kun tu 'dod chags pa dang / kun tu zhen pa dang / chums pa dang / lhag par zhen pa dang / sred pa dang / tshol ba dang / 'dod pa dang / rgyal ba dang / zhen pa dang /
analyzed: smras pa / 'dod chags pa dang / kun tu 'dod chags pa dang / kun tu zhen pa dang / chums pa dang / lhag par zhen pa dang / sred pa dang / tshol ba dang / 'dod pa dang / rgyal ba dang / zhen pa dang /
translated: It is desire, attachment, complete attachment, complete immersion, complete attachment, craving, seeking, longing, passion, lust,🔽complete lust, inner bondage, and the meaning of

original: yongs su zhen pa dang / nang gi 'ching ba dang / don du @377a *//
analyzed: yongs su zhen pa dang / nang gi 'ching ba dang / don du @377a *//
translated: bondage.

original: sgrub pa dang / brnab sems dang / sdug bsngal dang // kun 'byung ba la chags pa dang / chags pa las byung ba gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: sgrub pa dang / brnab sems dang / sdug bsngal dang // kun 'byung ba la chags pa dang / chags pa las byung ba gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: It is the practice of desire, covetousness, suffering, and attachment to the origin of suffering.

original: chags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “attachment.”

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the root of nonvirtue?

original: smras pa / chos de mi dge ba yin /
analyzed: smras pa / chos de mi dge ba yin /
translated: It is said that this is a nonvirtuous phenomenon.

original: de ni / mi dge ba'i chos mang po'i rtsa ba yang yin pas na /
analyzed: de ni / mi dge ba'i chos mang po'i rtsa ba yang yin pas na /
translated: It is also the root of many nonvirtuous phenomena.

original: de'i phyir de ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni /
translated: Therefore,

original: nad kyi rtsa ba dang / 'bras kyi rtsa ba dang / zug rngu'i rtsa ba dang / sdig pa'i rtsa ba dang / rnam par ma dag pa'i rtsa ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba dang / rnam par byang ba ma yin pa'i rtsa ba dang /
analyzed: nad kyi rtsa ba dang / 'bras kyi rtsa ba dang / zug rngu'i rtsa ba dang / sdig pa'i rtsa ba dang / rnam par ma dag pa'i rtsa ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba dang / rnam par byang ba ma yin pa'i rtsa ba dang /
translated: it is the root of disease, the root of boils, the root of pain, the root of evil, the root of impurity, the root of affliction, the root of non-purification,

original: yongs su byang ba ma yin pa'i rtsa ba yin te /
analyzed: yongs su byang ba ma yin pa'i rtsa ba yin te /
translated: and the root of non-purification.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
translated: attachment is called the root of nonvirtue.

original: zhe sdang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhe sdang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is the root of nonvirtue called “aversion”?

original: zhe sdang gang zhe na /
analyzed: zhe sdang gang zhe na /
translated: What is aversion?

original: smras pa; sems can rnams la kun nas mnar sems dang / tha ba dang / khong khro ba dang / gnod sems dang / gnod sems byed pa dang / gnod sems su gyur pa dang / sdang ba dang / rab tu sdang ba dang / sems kyis sdang ba gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: smras pa; sems can rnams la kun nas mnar sems dang / tha ba dang / khong khro ba dang / gnod sems dang / gnod sems byed pa dang / gnod sems su gyur pa dang / sdang ba dang / rab tu sdang ba dang / sems kyis sdang ba gang yin pa dang /
translated: hatred, extreme hatred, and mental hostility toward sentient beings.🔽It is the hostility,

original: sems can rnams la mi mthun par byed pa dang / sdang ba dang / sdang bar byed pa dang / sdang bar gyur pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: sems can rnams la mi mthun par byed pa dang / sdang ba dang / sdang bar byed pa dang / sdang bar gyur pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: hatred, and hostility toward sentient beings.

original: zhe sdang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‘hatred.’

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is called ‘unwholesome root’?

original: smras pa / chos de mi dge ba yin pa nas rgyas par yongs su byang ba ma yin pa'i rtsa ba zhes bya @377b ba'i bar du sbyar te /
analyzed: smras pa / chos de mi dge ba yin pa nas rgyas par yongs su byang ba ma yin pa'i rtsa ba zhes bya @377b ba'i bar du sbyar te /
translated: He replied, “It is the unwholesome, and so on, up to the root of the incomplete purification of phenomena.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: zhe sdang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
translated: hatred is called an unwholesome root.

original: gti mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gti mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: “What is called ‘delusion, an unwholesome root’?

original: gti mug gang zhe na /
analyzed: gti mug gang zhe na /
translated: What is delusion?

original: smras pa / sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pa dang / dbus mi shes pa dang / nang mi shes pa dang / phyi rol mi shes pa dang / nang dang phyi rol mi shes pa dang / las mi shes pa dang /🔽rnam par smin pa mi shes pa dang / las dang rnam par smin pa mi shes pa dang / las legs par byas pa mi shes pa dang / las nyes par byas pa mi shes pa dang / las legs par byas pa dang nyes par byas pa mi shes pa dang /
analyzed: smras pa / sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pa dang / dbus mi shes pa dang / nang mi shes pa dang / phyi rol mi shes pa dang / nang dang phyi rol mi shes pa dang / las mi shes pa dang / rnam par smin pa mi shes pa dang / las dang rnam par smin pa mi shes pa dang / las legs par byas pa mi shes pa dang / las nyes par byas pa mi shes pa dang / las legs par byas pa dang nyes par byas pa mi shes pa dang /
translated: He replied: “Not knowing the prior limit, not knowing the later limit, not knowing the middle, not knowing the inner, not knowing the outer, not knowing the inner and outer, not knowing karma,🔽not knowing ripening, not knowing karma and ripening, not knowing good karma, not knowing bad karma, not knowing good and bad karma,

original: rgyu mi shes pa dang / rgyu las skyes pa'i chos rnams mi shes pa dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / ngan pa dang / bzang po dang / nag pa dang / dkar ba dang /
analyzed: rgyu mi shes pa dang / rgyu las skyes pa'i chos rnams mi shes pa dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / ngan pa dang / bzang po dang / nag pa dang / dkar ba dang /
translated: not knowing causes, not knowing phenomena arisen from causes, not knowing what is reprehensible and what is not, not knowing what is bad and what is good, not knowing what is dark and what is bright,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa mi shes pa dang / reg pa'i skye mched drug yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du ma shes mi mthong ba dang / mun pa dang / rmongs pa dang / ma rig pa'i mun pa dang /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa mi shes pa dang / reg pa'i skye mched drug yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du ma shes mi mthong ba dang / mun pa dang / rmongs pa dang / ma rig pa'i mun pa dang /
translated: It is to not understand the phenomena of dependent origination and their classifications. It is to not see and not understand the six sense sources of contact as they truly are. It is to be in the dark, confused, and in the darkness of ignorance.

original: glen pa dang / rnyog pa can dang / bsgribs pa dang / chod pa dang / long bar byed pa dang / mig med par byed pa dang / shes rab dang mi mthun pa dang / phongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: glen pa dang / rnyog pa can dang / bsgribs pa dang / chod pa dang / long bar byed pa dang / mig med par byed pa dang / shes rab dang mi mthun pa dang / phongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ba dang /
translated: It is to be stupid, murky, obscured, blocked, blind, and eyeless. It is to be contrary to wisdom, to be in accord with the side of misfortune, and to not attain nirvāṇa.

original: ma rig pa dang / ma rig pa'i chu bo dang / ma rig pa'i dug gi rtsa ba dang / ma rig pa'i @378a *//
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / ma rig pa'i chu bo dang / ma rig pa'i dug gi rtsa ba dang / ma rig pa'i @378a *//
translated: It is ignorance, the river of ignorance, the poisonous root of ignorance, and the

original: dug gi sdong po dang / ma rig pa'i dug gi lo ma dang / ma rig pa'i dug gi me tog dang / ma rig pa'i dug gi 'bras bu dang / rmongs pa dang / kun tu rmongs pa dang / rab tu rmongs pa dang /
analyzed: dug gi sdong po dang / ma rig pa'i dug gi lo ma dang / ma rig pa'i dug gi me tog dang / ma rig pa'i dug gi 'bras bu dang / rmongs pa dang / kun tu rmongs pa dang / rab tu rmongs pa dang /
translated: the trunk of poison, the leaves of poison, the flowers of poison, the fruit of poison, delusion, complete delusion, utter delusion,

original: gti mug dang / gti mug las byung ba gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: gti mug dang / gti mug las byung ba gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: and what arises from delusion.

original: gti mug ces bya'o //
analyzed: gti mug ces bya'o //
translated: This is called delusion.

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the root of nonvirtue?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / chos de mi dge ba yin la /
analyzed: smras pa / chos de mi dge ba yin la /
translated: This is a nonvirtuous phenomenon,

original: de ni / mi dge ba'i chos mang po'i rtsa ba yang yin pas na /
analyzed: de ni / mi dge ba'i chos mang po'i rtsa ba yang yin pas na /
translated: and it is the root of many nonvirtuous phenomena.

original: de'i phyir de ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni /
translated: Therefore,🔽it is called the root of nonvirtue.🔽It is the root of disease,

original: nad kyi rtsa ba nas yongs su byung ba ma yin pa'i bar du sbyar te /
analyzed: nad kyi rtsa ba nas yongs su byung ba ma yin pa'i bar du sbyar te /
translated: up to the root of what does not come forth.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: gti mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gti mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
translated: delusion is called the root of nonvirtue.

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam ni /
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam ni /
translated: What are the ten paths of nonvirtuous action?

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub pa dang / tshig kyal pa dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang /
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub pa dang / tshig kyal pa dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang /
translated: Killing, taking what is not given, sexual misconduct, lying, slander, harsh speech, idle speech, covetousness, malice,

original: log par lta ba ste /
analyzed: log par lta ba ste /
translated: and wrong views.

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum po de dag ni /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum po de dag ni /
translated: These three unwholesome roots

original: mi dge ba'i las kyi lam 'di dag gi rgyu dang / rtsa ba dang / 'jug par byed pa dang / gzhi dang / byed rgyu dang / skyed pa dang / rkyen dang / kun nas slong ba'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las kyi lam 'di dag gi rgyu dang / rtsa ba dang / 'jug par byed pa dang / gzhi dang / byed rgyu dang / skyed pa dang / rkyen dang / kun nas slong ba'o //
translated: are the cause, root, instigator, basis, agent, producer, condition, and instigator of these unwholesome courses of action.

original: las gdags pa tshigs gnyis pa'o ////
analyzed: las gdags pa tshigs gnyis pa'o ////
translated: This is the second chapter, on the designation of action.🔽The summary verse says:

original: sdom ni / rgyu gang rnam rig byed min gzugs //
analyzed: sdom ni / rgyu gang rnam rig byed min gzugs //
translated: The cause is non-revealing form,

original: thogs bcas dang ni sems las byung //🔽chags pa dang ni zhe sdang gsum //
analyzed: thogs bcas dang ni sems las byung // chags pa dang ni zhe sdang gsum //
translated: Obstructed and arisen from mind.🔽Covetousness and malice arise

original: rnam pa @378b gsum du skye ba yin //
analyzed: rnam pa @378b gsum du skye ba yin //
translated: In three ways.

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam ni /
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam ni /
translated: The ten unwholesome courses of action

original: srog gcod pa nas log par lta ba'i bar dag go /
analyzed: srog gcod pa nas log par lta ba'i bar dag go /
translated: are from killing to wrong views.

original: srog gcod pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: srog gcod pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of killing?

original: smras pa / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni /
analyzed: smras pa / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni /
translated: It is the roots of nonvirtue and incorrect mental activity.

original: srog gcod pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: These are the causes of killing.

original: srog gcod pa gang gi rgyu zhe na /🔽smras pa / srog gcod pa ni /
analyzed: srog gcod pa gang gi rgyu zhe na / smras pa / srog gcod pa ni /
translated: What is the cause of killing?

original: srog gcod pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'o //🔽srog gcod pa ni /
analyzed: srog gcod pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'o // srog gcod pa ni /
translated: It is the cause of the maturation of killing.🔽What is the maturation of killing?

original: ci las byung /🔽kun 'byung ba ni /🔽gang / kun nas slong ba ni /
analyzed: ci las byung / kun 'byung ba ni / gang / kun nas slong ba ni /
translated: What is the origin of killing?🔽What is its origin?

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is its instigation?

original: smras pa / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni /
analyzed: smras pa / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni /
translated: It is the roots of nonvirtue and incorrect mental activity.

original: srog gcod pa kun nas slong ba'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa kun nas slong ba'o //
translated: These are the instigations of killing.

original: srog gcod pa gang gis kun nas bslang par bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: srog gcod pa gang gis kun nas bslang par bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: What is the instigation of killing?

original: smras pa / srog gcod pa kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / srog gcod pa kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyis so //
translated: It is the mind and mental activities that instigate killing.

original: srog gcod pa ci la dmigs she na /
analyzed: srog gcod pa ci la dmigs she na /
translated: What is the object of killing?

original: smras pa / sems can la dmigs so //
analyzed: smras pa / sems can la dmigs so //
translated: It is the sentient being.

original: srog gcod pa gang gi dmigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: srog gcod pa gang gi dmigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is the object of killing?

original: smras pa / srog gcod pa kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: smras pa / srog gcod pa kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyi'o //
translated: It is the life faculty of the sentient being.

original: srog gcod pa'i 'bras bu ci zhe na /
analyzed: srog gcod pa'i 'bras bu ci zhe na /
translated: What is the result of killing?

original: smras pa / mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu dang / mi gces pa'i 'bras bu dang / mi dge ba'i 'bras bu dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / yid du mi 'thad pa'i 'bras bu dang / mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: smras pa / mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu dang / mi gces pa'i 'bras bu dang / mi dge ba'i 'bras bu dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / yid du mi 'thad pa'i 'bras bu dang / mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: It is an unpleasant result, a result that is not cherished, an unwholesome result, a result that is not desirable, a result that is not agreeable, a result that is not wanted.

original: srog gcod pa gang gi 'bras bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: srog gcod pa gang gi 'bras bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is the result of killing?

original: smras @379a *// pa; srog gcod pa kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: smras @379a *// pa; srog gcod pa kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyi'o //
translated: It is the result of the mind and mental factors that instigate killing.

original: srog gcod pa'i rnam par smin pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: srog gcod pa'i rnam par smin pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the maturation of killing?

original: smras pa; mi sdug pa'i rnam par smin pa dang / mi gces pa'i rnam par smin pa dang / mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i rnam par smin pa dang / yid dang mi 'thad pa'i rnam par smin pa dang /🔽mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa; mi sdug pa'i rnam par smin pa dang / mi gces pa'i rnam par smin pa dang / mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i rnam par smin pa dang / yid dang mi 'thad pa'i rnam par smin pa dang / mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: unappealing, unwholesome, disagreeable, and undesirable.

original: srog gcod pa gang gi rnam par smin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: srog gcod pa gang gi rnam par smin pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the ripening of killing?

original: smras pa / srog gcod pa kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: smras pa / srog gcod pa kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyi'o //
translated: “The ripening of killing is the mind and mental factors that motivate killing.

original: srog gcod pa'i nyes dmigs ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: srog gcod pa'i nyes dmigs ci yin zhe na /
translated: “What are the disadvantages of killing?

original: smras pa / nyes dmigs lnga ste /
analyzed: smras pa / nyes dmigs lnga ste /
translated: “There are five disadvantages:

original: de bdag nyid kyis smad par 'gyur ba dang / de gzhan gyis smad par 'gyur ba dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams kyis dris na chos bzhin du smad par 'gyur ba dang / phyogs dang phyogs mtshams rnams su sdig can dang /
analyzed: de bdag nyid kyis smad par 'gyur ba dang / de gzhan gyis smad par 'gyur ba dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams kyis dris na chos bzhin du smad par 'gyur ba dang / phyogs dang phyogs mtshams rnams su sdig can dang /
translated: He will be despised by himself, despised by others, and despised by wise spiritual companions in accordance with the Dharma when questioned.🔽He will be known in all directions as a sinner, as one with an evil reputation, as one with an evil name, and as one with an evil life.

original: bsngags pa ma yin pa dang / snyan pa ma yin pa dang / dge ba ma yin pa'i sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa grags par 'gyur ba dang / lus dang bral ba shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro logs par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsngags pa ma yin pa dang / snyan pa ma yin pa dang / dge ba ma yin pa'i sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa grags par 'gyur ba dang / lus dang bral ba shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro logs par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After separating from the body, he will die and fall to the lower realms, to a bad rebirth, to the hells.

original: srog gcod pa su la nyes dmigs su 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: srog gcod pa su la nyes dmigs su 'gyur zhe na /
translated: “What are the problems for the one who kills?”

original: smras pa / gnyi ga @379b la nyes dmigs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: smras pa / gnyi ga @379b la nyes dmigs su 'gyur te /
translated: He said, “There are problems for both.

original: srog chags srog dang bral bar byed pa gang yin pa dang / srog chags gang srog dang bral bar bya ba la'o //
analyzed: srog chags srog dang bral bar byed pa gang yin pa dang / srog chags gang srog dang bral bar bya ba la'o //
translated: They are for the one who deprives a living being of life and for the living being who is to be deprived of life.”

original: ma byin par len pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of taking what is not given?

original: smras pa; mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / tshul bzhin ma yin la yid la byed pa ni /
analyzed: smras pa; mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / tshul bzhin ma yin la yid la byed pa ni /
translated: It is the roots of non-virtue and the improper mental activity.

original: ma byin par len pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: This is the cause of taking what is not given.

original: srog gcod pa ji lta ba bzhin du rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa ji lta ba bzhin du rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be explained as in the case of killing.

original: de la khyad par ni 'di yin te; ma byin par len pa ni /
analyzed: de la khyad par ni 'di yin te; ma byin par len pa ni /
translated: The difference is this: taking what is not given is based on property.🔽The other is based on a living being.

original: yo byad la dmigs so //🔽gnyi ga la nyes dmigs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: yo byad la dmigs so // gnyi ga la nyes dmigs su 'gyur te /
translated: Both are based on a living being.

original: ma byin par len pa gang yin pa dang / gang gi ma byin par len pa'i //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa gang yin pa dang / gang gi ma byin par len pa'i //
translated: The taking of what is not given and that which is taken by way of the taking of what is not given.

original: 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa gang la dmigs she na /
analyzed: 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa gang la dmigs she na /
translated: With regard to sexual misconduct, what is the object?

original: sems can la dmigs so //🔽gnyi ga la nyas dmigs su 'gyur te /🔽'dod pa rnams la log par g-yem pa gang yin pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pas gang la kun tu spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sems can la dmigs so // gnyi ga la nyas dmigs su 'gyur te / 'dod pa rnams la log par g-yem pa gang yin pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pas gang la kun tu spyod pa'o //
translated: It is a living being.🔽Both are based on a living being.🔽Sexual misconduct and the object of sexual misconduct.

original: brdzun du smra ba ni /
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba ni /
translated: With regard to false speech, what is the object?

original: ming la dmigs so //🔽gnyi ga la nyes dmigs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: ming la dmigs so //🔽gnyi ga la nyes dmigs su 'gyur te /
translated: It is a name.🔽Both are based on a name.

original: brdzun du smra ba gang yin pa dang / brdzun du smra bas bslu bar bya ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba gang yin pa dang / brdzun du smra bas bslu bar bya ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the person who lies and the person who is deceived by the lie.

original: phra ma yang ming la dmigs so //
analyzed: phra ma yang ming la dmigs so //
translated: Slander is based on names.

original: gsum la nyes dmigs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: gsum la nyes dmigs su 'gyur te /
translated: It is based on three things:

original: mdza' bo 'byed pa gang yin pa dang / mdza' bo gang las phye ba dang / gang gi mdza' bo phye ba'o //
analyzed: mdza' bo 'byed pa gang yin pa dang / mdza' bo gang las phye ba dang / gang gi mdza' bo phye ba'o //
translated: the person who is separated, the person who separates, and the person from whom the separation is made.

original: tshig rtsub po yang ming la dmigs so //
analyzed: tshig rtsub po yang ming la dmigs so //
translated: Harsh speech is based on names.

original: gnyi ga la nyes dmigs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnyi ga la nyes dmigs su 'gyur te /
translated: It is based on two things:

original: tshig rtsub po smra ba gang yin pa dang / tshig rtsub pos gang la kun tu spyo ba'o //
analyzed: tshig rtsub po smra ba gang yin pa dang / tshig rtsub pos gang la kun tu spyo ba'o //
translated: the person who speaks harshly and the person who is insulted by the harsh speech.

original: @380a *// tshig kyal pa yang ming la dmigs so //
analyzed: @380a *// tshig kyal pa yang ming la dmigs so //
translated: Frivolous speech is based on names.

original: gnyi ga la nyes dmigs su 'gyur te /🔽tshig kyal pa smra ba gang yin pa dang / tshig kyal pas gang la bslu ba'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga la nyes dmigs su 'gyur te / tshig kyal pa smra ba gang yin pa dang / tshig kyal pas gang la bslu ba'o //
translated: It is based on two things:

original: brnab sems ni /
analyzed: brnab sems ni /
translated: the person who speaks frivolously and the person who is deceived by the frivolous speech.🔽Covetousness

original: yo byad la dmigs so //🔽gnyi ga la nyes dmigs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: yo byad la dmigs so //🔽gnyi ga la nyes dmigs su 'gyur te /
translated: is based on objects.🔽It is based on two things:🔽the object that is coveted and the person who covets it.

original: brnab sems bskyed pa gang yin pa dang / gang gi dngos po la brnab sems skyed pa'o //
analyzed: brnab sems bskyed pa gang yin pa dang / gang gi dngos po la brnab sems skyed pa'o //
translated: It is the generation of covetousness and the object of that covetousness.

original: gnod sems ni /
analyzed: gnod sems ni /
translated: It is the one who has generated covetousness and the object of his covetousness.🔽Malice

original: sems can la dmigs so //🔽gnyi ga la nyes dmigs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can la dmigs so // gnyi ga la nyes dmigs su 'gyur te /
translated: is focused on sentient beings.

original: gnod sems byed pa gang yin pa dang / gang gi rgyud la gnod sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: gnod sems byed pa gang yin pa dang / gang gi rgyud la gnod sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: It is the one who has generated malice and the continuum of the one toward whom he has generated malice.

original: log par lta ba'i rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: log par lta ba'i rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of wrong views?

original: smras pa / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni /🔽log par lta ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: smras pa / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni / log par lta ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: It is the roots of nonvirtue and incorrect mental activity.

original: log par lta ba'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: log par lta ba'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of the ripening of wrong views?

original: smras pa / log par lta ba ni /🔽log par lta ba'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: smras pa / log par lta ba ni / log par lta ba'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: It is wrong views.

original: log par lta ba ci las 'byung /🔽kun 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: log par lta ba ci las 'byung / kun 'byung ba ni /
translated: What is the origin of wrong views?🔽What is its source?

original: gang / kun nas slong ba ni; gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang / kun nas slong ba ni; gang zhe na /
translated: What is its basis?

original: smras pa / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa ni /
analyzed: smras pa / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa ni /
translated: It is the roots of nonvirtue and incorrect mental activity.

original: log par lta bas kun nas slong ba'o //
analyzed: log par lta bas kun nas slong ba'o //
translated: It is motivated by wrong views.

original: log par lta ba gang gi kun nas bslang bar bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: log par lta ba gang gi kun nas bslang bar bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: What is the motivation for wrong views?

original: smras pa / log par lta ba kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: smras pa / log par lta ba kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyi'o //
translated: It is the mind and mental factors that motivate wrong views.

original: log par lta ba ci la dmigs she na /
analyzed: log par lta ba ci la dmigs she na /
translated: What is the object of wrong views?

original: @380b smras pa; ming dang / gzugs la dmigs so //
analyzed: @380b smras pa; ming dang / gzugs la dmigs so //
translated: It is name-and-form.

original: log par lta ba gang gi dmigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: log par lta ba gang gi dmigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is the object of wrong views?

original: smras pa / log par lta ba kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: smras pa / log par lta ba kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyi'o //
translated: It is the mind and mental factors that motivate wrong views.

original: log par lta ba'i 'bras bu ci zhe na /
analyzed: log par lta ba'i 'bras bu ci zhe na /
translated: What is the result of wrong views?

original: smras pa / mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu dang / mi gces pa'i 'bras bu dang / mi dge ba'i 'bras bu dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / yid du mi 'thad pa'i 'bras bu dang / mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: smras pa / mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu dang / mi gces pa'i 'bras bu dang / mi dge ba'i 'bras bu dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / yid du mi 'thad pa'i 'bras bu dang / mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: It is an unpleasant result, a result that is not cherished, an unwholesome result, a result that is not desirable, a result that is not agreeable, a result that is not wanted.

original: log par lta ba gang gi 'bras bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: log par lta ba gang gi 'bras bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is the result of wrong views?

original: smras pa / log par lta ba kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: smras pa / log par lta ba kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyi'o //
translated: He said: “It is the ripening of the mind and mental factors that motivate wrong view.

original: log par lta ba'i rnam par smin pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: log par lta ba'i rnam par smin pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the ripening of wrong view?

original: smras pa / mi sdug pa'i rnam par smin pa dang / mi gces pa'i rnam par smin pa dang / mi dge ba'i rnams par smin pa dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i rnam par smin pa dang / yid du mi 'thad pa'i rnam par smin pa dang /
analyzed: smras pa / mi sdug pa'i rnam par smin pa dang / mi gces pa'i rnam par smin pa dang / mi dge ba'i rnams par smin pa dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i rnam par smin pa dang / yid du mi 'thad pa'i rnam par smin pa dang /
translated: He said: “The ripening of what is ugly, the ripening of what is not cherished, the ripening of what is unwholesome, the ripening of what is disagreeable, the ripening of what is not pleasing,

original: mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: the ripening of what is undesirable.

original: log par lta ba gang gi rnam par smin pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: log par lta ba gang gi rnam par smin pa yin zhe na /
translated: Whose ripening is it?

original: smras pa / log par lta ba kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems dang sems las ibyung ba'i chos rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: smras pa / log par lta ba kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems dang sems las ibyung ba'i chos rnams kyi'o //
translated: He said: “It is the ripening of the mind and mental factors that motivate wrong view.

original: log par lta ba'i nyes dmigs ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: log par lta ba'i nyes dmigs ci yin zhe na /
translated: What are the disadvantages of wrong view?

original: smras pa / nyes dmigs lnga ste /
analyzed: smras pa / nyes dmigs lnga ste /
translated: He said: “There are five disadvantages.

original: de bdag nyid kyis smad par 'gyur ba dang / de gzhan gyis smad par 'gyur ba bdang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas @381a *//
analyzed: de bdag nyid kyis smad par 'gyur ba dang / de gzhan gyis smad par 'gyur ba bdang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas @381a *//
translated: They will be despised by themselves, by others, and by the wise who practice pure conduct.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gang zhe na /🔽smras pa / tshig kyal pa las phyir ma log cing /🔽phyir ma nur la ma btang ma spangs pas ci ste na tshig gis kyang rnam par rig par mi byed pa 'di ni /

translated: It is the non-performance of an action, the non-undertaking of an action, the non-doing of an action, the non-performance of an action by body, speech or mind.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //🔽brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba rnam par rig byed ces bya'am /🔽'on te rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na /🔽smras pa / rnam par rig byed kyang ma yin /🔽rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o // brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba rnam par rig byed ces bya'am / 'on te rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na / smras pa / rnam par rig byed kyang ma yin / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is the non-performance of an action, the non-undertaking of an action, the non-doing of an action, the non-performance of an action by body, speech or mind, because one has not turned away from idle chatter,

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar te /🔽srog gcod pa gzugs ces bya ba'am /🔽'on te gzugs can ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na /🔽smras pa / gzugs can zhes bya'o //🔽de bzhin du ma byin par len pa dang / @384a *//
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar te /🔽srog gcod pa gzugs ces bya ba'am /🔽'on te gzugs can ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na /🔽smras pa / gzugs can zhes bya'o //🔽de bzhin du ma byin par len pa dang / @384a *//
translated: because one has not turned away from the taking up of what is not Dharma, because one has not turned away from the taking up of wrong views, because one has not turned away from wrong original: 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig kyal pa gzugs can zhes bya'am /
analyzed: 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig kyal pa gzugs can zhes bya'am /
translated: Sexual misconduct, lying, slander, and idle speech are called “physical.”🔽

original: 'on te gzugs can ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na; smras pa /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs can ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na; smras pa /
translated: Are sexual misconduct, lying, slander, and idle speech said to be material or immaterial?

original: gzugs can zhes bya'o //🔽brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba gzugs can zhes bya'am /
analyzed: gzugs can zhes bya'o // brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba gzugs can zhes bya'am /
translated: They are said to be material.

original: 'on te gzugs can ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs can ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Are covetousness, malice, and wrong views said to be material or immaterial?

original: smras pa; gzugs can ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa; gzugs can ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are said to be immaterial.

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar te /🔽srog gcod pa thogs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'am /
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar te / srog gcod pa thogs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'am /
translated: From the ten unwholesome courses of action up to the extensive explanation,

original: 'on te thogs pa med pa zhes bya zhe na /🔽smras pa / thogs pa dang bcas pa yang yod /
analyzed: 'on te thogs pa med pa zhes bya zhe na / smras pa / thogs pa dang bcas pa yang yod /
translated: is killing said to be impeded or unimpeded?

original: thogs pa med pa yang yod do //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa yang yod do //
translated: It is said to be both impeded and unimpeded.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is impeded?

original: smras pa / rnam par rig byed gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / rnam par rig byed gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is said to be any intimation.

original: thogs pa med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is unimpeded?

original: smras pa / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: He replied, “It is non-revealing karma.”

original: srog gcod pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: srog gcod pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as with killing,

original: ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: so too should you understand stealing, sexual misconduct, lying, slander, harsh speech, and idle speech.

original: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba thogs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'am; 'on te thogs pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba thogs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'am; 'on te thogs pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Are covetousness, malice, and wrong view said to be impeded or unimpeded?

original: smras pa / thogs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / thogs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He replied, “They are said to be unimpeded.”

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar te /🔽srog gcod pa sems las byung @384b ba zhes bya'am /🔽'on te sems las byung ba ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar te / srog gcod pa sems las byung @384b ba zhes bya'am / 'on te sems las byung ba ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: From the ten unwholesome courses of action up to the ten wholesome courses of action,🔽are killing and so on said to be mental or not mental?

original: smras pa / sems las byung ba ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / sems las byung ba ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He replied, “They are said not to be mental.”

original: srog gcod pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig khyal pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig khyal pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as with killing, so it is with taking what is not given, sexual misconduct, false speech, slander, harsh speech, and idle speech.

original: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba sems las byung ba zhes bya'am /
analyzed: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba sems las byung ba zhes bya'am /
translated: Are covetousness, malice, and wrong views mental factors?

original: 'on te sems las byung ba ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sems las byung ba ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Or are they not mental factors?

original: smras pa / sems las byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / sems las byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: They are mental factors.

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar te /🔽srog gcod pa ni /
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar te / srog gcod pa ni /
translated: The ten unwholesome courses of action are explained in detail.

original: rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Killing is of three types:🔽arisen from attachment, arisen from aversion, and arisen from delusion.

original: chags pa las byung ba dang / zhe sdang las byung ba dang / gti mug las byung ba dang / srog gcod pa chags pa las byung ba gang zhe na /🔽smras pa / ji ltar 'di na kha cig srog chags gang gi sha'am /
analyzed: chags pa las byung ba dang / zhe sdang las byung ba dang / gti mug las byung ba dang / srog gcod pa chags pa las byung ba gang zhe na / smras pa / ji ltar 'di na kha cig srog chags gang gi sha'am /
translated: What is killing that is arisen from attachment?

original: pags pa'am / rva'am /
analyzed: pags pa'am / rva'am /
translated: It is like this: for example, here some people kill living beings for the sake of the flesh,🔽skin,

original: so'am / rus pa'am /
analyzed: so'am / rus pa'am /
translated: bones,

original: rgyus pa'am / mjug ma 'dod de /
analyzed: rgyus pa'am / mjug ma 'dod de /
translated: or the tail.

original: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis srog chags kyi srog gcod par byed do //
analyzed: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis srog chags kyi srog gcod par byed do //
translated: For that reason and for that cause, he kills living beings.

original: de ma yin te /
analyzed: de ma yin te /
translated: It is not so.

original: bdag nyid mi 'dod du zin kyang de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: bdag nyid mi 'dod du zin kyang de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Even though he does not desire it, he thinks this:🔽“Whatever living beings are dear to me, loved by me, and pleasing to me, for their sake these will be necessities and enjoyments.”

original: sems can bdag la sdug pa dang / gces pa dang / yid du 'ong ba gang yin pa de dag la mkho ba dang longs spyod du 'gyur ro snyam nas de dag gi don du srog chags kyi srog gcod par byed do //
analyzed: sems can bdag la sdug pa dang / gces pa dang / yid du 'ong ba gang yin pa de dag la mkho ba dang longs spyod du 'gyur ro snyam nas de dag gi don du srog chags kyi srog gcod par byed do //
translated: For their sake, he kills living beings.🔽Or else, others say to him:

original: yang na gzhan gyis de la 'di skad du khyod tshur shog la @385a *//
analyzed: yang na gzhan gyis de la 'di skad du khyod tshur shog la @385a *//
translated: “Come here, so-and-so!

original: srog chags 'di lta bu zhig gi srog chod cig dang / ngas khyod la 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig sbyin no //
analyzed: srog chags 'di lta bu zhig gi srog chod cig dang / ngas khyod la 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig sbyin no //
translated: Kill such-and-such a living being, and I will give you such-and-such a thing.

original: 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig bya'o //
translated: I will do such-and-such a thing for you.”

original: zhes bsgos nas des longs spyod de dag 'dod nas srog chags kyi srog gcod par byed do /
analyzed: zhes bsgos nas des longs spyod de dag 'dod nas srog chags kyi srog gcod par byed do /
translated: Because he desires those enjoyments, he kills living beings.

original: dper na / rgyal po gnyis phan tshun mi mthun pa der ras sam /
analyzed: dper na / rgyal po gnyis phan tshun mi mthun pa der ras sam /
translated: For example, two kings are hostile to each other.

original: dong tse'am / dong tse stong gi phyir mgo khyer te 'ong bar byed cing /🔽des longs spyod de dag 'dod nas srog chags kyi srog gcod par byed pa de lta bu ni /
analyzed: dong tse'am / dong tse stong gi phyir mgo khyer te 'ong bar byed cing / des longs spyod de dag 'dod nas srog chags kyi srog gcod par byed pa de lta bu ni /
translated: For the sake of a coin or a thousand coins, he would go to the extent of selling his head.🔽He would kill living beings for the sake of those enjoyments.

original: chags pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: chags pa las byung ba yin no //
translated: This is killing that is rooted in attachment.

original: zhe sdang las byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: zhe sdang las byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is killing that is rooted in aversion?

original: smras pa; ji ltar 'di na kha cig gang la kun nas mnar sems dang / gsod pa'i sems yod pa'i phyir srog chags de'i srog gcod par byed do //🔽de ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa; ji ltar 'di na kha cig gang la kun nas mnar sems dang / gsod pa'i sems yod pa'i phyir srog chags de'i srog gcod par byed do // de ma yin te /
translated: It is when someone kills a living being out of a mind of malice and a mind of killing.

original: de la kun nas mnar sems dang / gsod pa'i sems med du zin kyang /
analyzed: de la kun nas mnar sems dang / gsod pa'i sems med du zin kyang /
translated: It is not that he does not have a mind of malice and a mind of killing.🔽But he has a mind of malice and a mind of killing toward those living beings who are dear to him, who are cherished by him, who are loved by him, and who are pleasing to him.

original: gang gi srog chags sdug pa dang / gces pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba de dag la kun nas mnar sems dang / gsod pa'i sems yod pa'i phyir de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gang gi srog chags sdug pa dang / gces pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba de dag la kun nas mnar sems dang / gsod pa'i sems yod pa'i phyir de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks:

original: de dag yun ring por mi bzod cing mi bde la sems mngon par mi dga' bar 'gyur bar bya'o snyam nas srog chags de'i srog gcod par byed pa de lta bu ni /
analyzed: de dag yun ring por mi bzod cing mi bde la sems mngon par mi dga' bar 'gyur bar bya'o snyam nas srog chags de'i srog gcod par byed pa de lta bu ni /
translated: I will not endure this for long. I will not be happy. I will not be pleased.

original: zhe sdang las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: zhe sdang las byung ba yin no //
translated: ’ In this way, killing arises from hatred.

original: gti mug las byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gti mug las byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How does killing arise from delusion?

original: dper na / bram ze dag 'di skad du sbrul dang / sdig pa dang / srog chags @385b tre la ta dang / tre ma bu ka dang / srin gyi med la sogs pa 'di dag ni /🔽gsad par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na / bram ze dag 'di skad du sbrul dang / sdig pa dang / srog chags @385b tre la ta dang / tre ma bu ka dang / srin gyi med la sogs pa 'di dag ni / gsad par bya'o //
translated: For example, some Brahmins say, ‘Kill snakes, scorpions, centipedes, and spiders.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽smras pa / 'di dag ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / smras pa / 'di dag ni /
translated: Why?🔽They say, ‘These are the enemies and adversaries of humans.

original: mi rnams kyi dgra dang / phyir rgol ba yin pa'i phyir ro; ;glang po che dang / rta dang / rnga mo dang / ba lang dang / bong bu la sogs pa 'di dag kyang gsad par bya'o //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi dgra dang / phyir rgol ba yin pa'i phyir ro; ;glang po che dang / rta dang / rnga mo dang / ba lang dang / bong bu la sogs pa 'di dag kyang gsad par bya'o //
translated: Kill elephants, horses, camels, oxen, donkeys, and so on.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: smras pa / 'di dag ni /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di dag ni /
translated: They say, ‘These are the enemies and adversaries of humans.

original: mi rnams kyi longs spyod yin pa'i phyir ro; ;zhes zer ba lta bu dang / nub phyogs na bram ze mchu skyes zhes bya ba dag yod de /
analyzed: mi rnams kyi longs spyod yin pa'i phyir ro; ;zhes zer ba lta bu dang / nub phyogs na bram ze mchu skyes zhes bya ba dag yod de /
translated: In the west, there are Brahmins called “Born-with-a-mouth.”

original: de dag ni /
analyzed: de dag ni /
translated: They say:

original: 'di skad du gang pha'am /
analyzed: 'di skad du gang pha'am /
translated: “If a father,🔽mother,

original: ma'am / phu nu bo'am /
analyzed: ma'am / phu nu bo'am /
translated: brother,🔽sister,

original: sring mo'am / mdza' bo'am /
analyzed: sring mo'am / mdza' bo'am /
translated: friend,

original: gnyen dang / rgan rabs gang yang rung ba nad kyis thabs te sdug bsngal zhing nad tshabs che ba'i srog gcod pa la ni /
analyzed: gnyen dang / rgan rabs gang yang rung ba nad kyis thabs te sdug bsngal zhing nad tshabs che ba'i srog gcod pa la ni /
translated: relative, or elder is sick, suffering, and gravely ill,

original: bsod nams mang po 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsod nams mang po 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: killing them increases merit.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: smras pa; de ji srid kyi bar du gson zhing 'dug la sdod cing 'tsho ba de srid kyi bar du sdug bsngal zhing yid du mi 'ong bas gnas la /
analyzed: smras pa; de ji srid kyi bar du gson zhing 'dug la sdod cing 'tsho ba de srid kyi bar du sdug bsngal zhing yid du mi 'ong bas gnas la /
translated: They say: ‘As long as they live, stay, endure, and remain alive, they are miserable and live unpleasantly.

original: lus dang bral na ni /
analyzed: lus dang bral na ni /
translated: But when they are separated from the body,

original: de lta ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is not the case.’

original: zhes zer te /
analyzed: zhes zer te /
translated: They say that,

original: las de la ci'ang mi 'ong bar lta zhing 'bras bu med par lta la 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du smra ste /
analyzed: las de la ci'ang mi 'ong bar lta zhing 'bras bu med par lta la 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du smra ste /
translated: and they see that action as bringing nothing at all and as having no result. They see it like this and say:

original: las 'di med do //
analyzed: las 'di med do //
translated: There is no such thing as action.

original: las 'di'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do //
analyzed: las 'di'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do //
translated: There is no such thing as the maturation of the fruit of action.

original: zhes zer ba de lta bu ni /
analyzed: zhes zer ba de lta bu ni /
translated: Such a view

original: gti mug las byung ba yin no //🔽ma byin par len pa ni /
analyzed: gti mug las byung ba yin no // ma byin par len pa ni /
translated: arises from delusion.

original: rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Stealing is of three kinds:

original: chags pa las byung ba dang / zhe sdang las byung ba dang / gti mug las byung ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa las byung ba dang / zhe sdang las byung ba dang / gti mug las byung ba'o //
translated: arising from attachment, arising from hatred, and arising from delusion.🔽What is stealing arising from attachment?

original: @386a *// ma byin par len pa chags pa las byung ba gang zhe na /🔽smras pa / ji ltar 'di na kha cig yo byad gang 'dod pa de des gzhan dag la ma byin par len par byed do //
analyzed: @386a *// ma byin par len pa chags pa las byung ba gang zhe na / smras pa / ji ltar 'di na kha cig yo byad gang 'dod pa de des gzhan dag la ma byin par len par byed do //
translated: It is when someone takes what is not given to him out of desire for an object.

original: de ma yin te /🔽bdag nyid mi 'dod du zin kyang de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de ma yin te / bdag nyid mi 'dod du zin kyang de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: It is not that he does not want it for himself,

original: sems can bdag la sdug pa dang / gces pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba de dag la mkho ba dang / 'chang ba dang / longs spyod du 'gyur ro snyam nas de dag gi don du gzhan dag las ma byin par len par byed do //
analyzed: sems can bdag la sdug pa dang / gces pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba de dag la mkho ba dang / 'chang ba dang / longs spyod du 'gyur ro snyam nas de dag gi don du gzhan dag las ma byin par len par byed do //
translated: but he thinks, “This will be useful to my friends, my kinsmen, my relatives, my attendants, my army, my harem, my servants, my workers, my laborers, my ministers, my counselors, my priests, my astrologers, my physicians, my architects, my builders, my engineers, my cooks, my bakers, my washermen, my weavers, my tailors, my garland makers, my barbers, my bath attendants, my dancers, my singers, my musicians, my actors, my servants, my messengers, my doorkeepers, my guards, my bodyguards, my companions, my friends, my relatives, my kinsmen, my parents, my brothers, my sisters, my wife, my children, my grandchildren, my male and female servants, my cattle, my elephants, my horses, my chariots, my carriages, my donkeys, my camels, my goats, my sheep, my chickens, my pigs, my dogs, my cats, my birds, my bees, my fish, my turtles, my tortoises, my alligators, my crocodiles, my snakes, my scorpions, my spiders, my ants, my lice, my fleas, my flies, my mosquitoes, my worms, my moths, my locusts, my bees, my birds, my wild animals, my deer, my elephants, my lions, my tigers, my leopards, my bears, my hyenas, my wolves, my foxes, my jackals, my monkeys, my apes, my humans, my non-humans, my gods, my demigods, my gandharvas, my kinnaras, my mahoragas, my yakshas, my rakshasas, my kumbhandas, my piśācas, my bhutas, my pretas, my pūtanas, my kaṭapūtanas, my ojohāras, my grahas, my unmadas, my apasmāras, my skandhas, my āyatanas, my dhātus

original: yang na gzhan dag de la 'di skad du khyod tshur shog la ming 'di zhes bya ba las ma byin par longs shig dang / ngas khyod la 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig sbyin no //
analyzed: yang na gzhan dag de la 'di skad du khyod tshur shog la ming 'di zhes bya ba las ma byin par longs shig dang / ngas khyod la 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig sbyin no //
translated: I will give you this and that.

original: 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig bya'o //🔽zhes bsgos nas des longs spyod de dag 'dod nas gzhan dag las ma byin par len par byed pa de lta bu ni /

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the type of lying that arises from delusion?

original: dper na / dgon pa'i ri dvags mthong la rngon pas de la dris te /
analyzed: dper na / dgon pa'i ri dvags mthong la rngon pas de la dris te /
translated: For example, a hunter sees a wild animal and asks a question about it.

original: khyod kyis ri dvags mthong ngam zhes byas na /
analyzed: khyod kyis ri dvags mthong ngam zhes byas na /
translated: “Did you see a wild animal?”

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The hunter thinks:

original: rngon pas ri dvags gsad na mi rung ngo snyam nas de la ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: rngon pas ri dvags gsad na mi rung ngo snyam nas de la ma mthong ngo //
translated: “It is not right to kill a wild animal.” He says to the hunter, “I did not see anything.”

original: zhes zer ba lta bu dang / dper na /🔽mi rgod kyi dpung mthong la rgyal po'i dpung gis de la dris te /
analyzed: zhes zer ba lta bu dang / dper na / mi rgod kyi dpung mthong la rgyal po'i dpung gis de la dris te /
translated: It is like the following analogy:🔽For example, when a king’s army sees a band of wild men, they ask them,

original: ci khyod kyis mi rgod kyi dpung mthong dam zhes byas na /
analyzed: ci khyod kyis mi rgod kyi dpung mthong dam zhes byas na /
translated: “Did you see a band of wild men?”

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: They think,🔽“It is not right for the king’s army to kill a band of wild men,” and they say,

original: rgyal po'i dpung gis mi rgod kyi dpung gsad na mi rung ngo snyam nas bdag gis ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: rgyal po'i dpung gis mi rgod kyi dpung gsad na mi rung ngo snyam nas bdag gis ma mthong ngo //
translated: “We did not see them.”

original: zhes zer pa lta bu dang / dper na /
analyzed: zhes zer pa lta bu dang / dper na /
translated: It is like the following analogy:🔽When a band of wild men see a king’s army, they ask them,

original: rgyal po'i dpung mthong la ci khyod kyis rgyal po'i dpung mthong ngam zhes de la dris na /
analyzed: rgyal po'i dpung mthong la ci khyod kyis rgyal po'i dpung mthong ngam zhes de la dris na /
translated: “Did you see a king’s army?”

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /🔽mi rgod kyi dpung gis rgyal po'i dpung gsad na mi rung snyam nas bdag gis ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te / mi rgod kyi dpung gis rgyal po'i dpung gsad na mi rung snyam nas bdag gis ma mthong ngo //
translated: They think,🔽“It is not right for a band of wild men to kill a king’s army,” and they say,

original: zhes zer ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: zhes zer ba lta bu ste /
translated: “We did not see them.”

original: las de la ci'ang mi 'ong bar lta zhing 'bras bu med par lta la 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du smra ste /
analyzed: las de la ci'ang mi 'ong bar lta zhing 'bras bu med par lta la 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du smra ste /
translated: They see that action as bringing nothing at all and as having no result. They see it in this way and say this.

original: las 'di med do; ;las 'di'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do //🔽zhes gti mug las byung ba'i brdzun du smra bar byed pa de lta bu ni /
analyzed: las 'di med do; ;las 'di'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do // zhes gti mug las byung ba'i brdzun du smra bar byed pa de lta bu ni /
translated: “This action does not exist. This action’s result does not exist.”🔽Such lying that arises from delusion

original: gti mug las byung ba yin no //🔽phra mo ni /
analyzed: gti mug las byung ba yin no // phra mo ni /
translated: is lying that arises from delusion.🔽Slander is of three types:

original: rnam pa gsum ste; chags pa las byung ba dang / zhe sdang las byung ba dang / gti mug las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste; chags pa las byung ba dang / zhe sdang las byung ba dang / gti mug las byung ba'o //
translated: that which arises from attachment, that which arises from aversion, and that which arises from delusion.

original: phra ma chags pa las byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: phra ma chags pa las byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is slander that arises from attachment?

original: smras pa / ji ltar 'di na kha cig yo byad gang 'dod @389b pa de'i rgyu dang de'i rkyen gyis de gzhan dag gi mdza' bo 'byed par byed do //
analyzed: smras pa / ji ltar 'di na kha cig yo byad gang 'dod @389b pa de'i rgyu dang de'i rkyen gyis de gzhan dag gi mdza' bo 'byed par byed do //
translated: It is when someone, for the sake of obtaining some object, divides others who are friends.

original: de ma yin te /
analyzed: de ma yin te /
translated: It is not that.

original: bdag nyid mi 'dod du zin kyang de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: bdag nyid mi 'dod du zin kyang de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Even though one does not want to, one thinks:🔽“

original: sems can bdag las sdug pa dang / gces pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba gang yin pa de dag la mkho ba dang / 'chang ba dang / longs spyod du 'gyur ro snyam nas de dag gi don du gzhan dag gi mdza' ba 'byed par byed do; ;yang na gzhan gyis de la 'di skad du khyod tshur shog la ming 'di zhes bya ba'i mdza' bo phye zhig dang /🔽ngas khyod la 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig sbyin no //
analyzed: sems can bdag las sdug pa dang / gces pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba gang yin pa de dag la mkho ba dang / 'chang ba dang / longs spyod du 'gyur ro snyam nas de dag gi don du gzhan dag gi mdza' ba 'byed par byed do; ;yang na gzhan gyis de la 'di skad du khyod tshur shog la ming 'di zhes bya ba'i mdza' bo phye zhig dang / ngas khyod la 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig sbyin no //
translated: Or, when others tell them, ‘Come here, and divide the friends of so-and-so,🔽and I will give you this and that,

original: 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig bya'o //
translated: and I will do this and that for you,’

original: zhes bsgos nas des longs spyod de dag 'dod nas gzhan dag gi mdza' bo 'byed par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bsgos nas des longs spyod de dag 'dod nas gzhan dag gi mdza' bo 'byed par byed do //
translated: they cause division among those who are close to others because they want those enjoyments.

original: dper na / bram ze'i bsod snyoms ster pa'i khyim nor ma bgos pa de dag las de'i lhung bzed gcig dang / gos gcig dang / zan gcig pu 'ong ba la de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: dper na / bram ze'i bsod snyoms ster pa'i khyim nor ma bgos pa de dag las de'i lhung bzed gcig dang / gos gcig dang / zan gcig pu 'ong ba la de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: For example, in a house where a brahmin’s alms are distributed, only one bowl, one garment, and one meal come from that house.

original: ji srid du 'di dag lhan cig na 'khod cing mthun pa de srid du 'di dag las bdag gi lhung bzed gcig dang / gos gcig dang / zan gcig pu 'ong gi /
analyzed: ji srid du 'di dag lhan cig na 'khod cing mthun pa de srid du 'di dag las bdag gi lhung bzed gcig dang / gos gcig dang / zan gcig pu 'ong gi /
translated: As long as they remain together and in harmony, I will not get their alms-bowl, robe, or food.🔽I must do something to divide them.”

original: bdag gis 'di dag dbye ba'i thabs shig bya gor ma chag snyam nas de dag 'byed pa'i thabs byed pa lta bu dang / dper na; rgyal po gnyis phan tshun mi mthun te /🔽nang na 'khod pa rnams ni /🔽phyi rol gyi longs spyod 'dod nas phyi rol pa rnams dbye ba'i thabs byed la /
analyzed: bdag gis 'di dag dbye ba'i thabs shig bya gor ma chag snyam nas de dag 'byed pa'i thabs byed pa lta bu dang / dper na; rgyal po gnyis phan tshun mi mthun te / nang na 'khod pa rnams ni / phyi rol gyi longs spyod 'dod nas phyi rol pa rnams dbye ba'i thabs byed la /
translated: For example, it is like two kings who are hostile to each other.

original: phyi rol pa rnams ni /🔽nang gi longs @390a *//
analyzed: phyi rol pa rnams ni / nang gi longs @390a *//
translated: Those who are on the inside want the external enjoyments, so they try to divide the outsiders.

original: spyod 'dod nas nang na 'khod pa rnams dbye ba'i thabs byed pa de lta bu ni /
analyzed: spyod 'dod nas nang na 'khod pa rnams dbye ba'i thabs byed pa de lta bu ni /
translated: Those who are on the outside want the internal enjoyments, so they try to divide those on the inside.

original: chags pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: chags pa las byung ba yin no //
translated: This is what arises from attachment.

original: zhe sdang las byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: zhe sdang las byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What arises from aversion?

original: smras pa / ji ltar 'di na kha cig gang la kun nas mnar sems dang khro ba'i sems yod pa'i phyir de'i mdza' bo 'byed par byed do //
analyzed: smras pa / ji ltar 'di na kha cig gang la kun nas mnar sems dang khro ba'i sems yod pa'i phyir de'i mdza' bo 'byed par byed do //
translated: He said: It is like the case of someone who, because of a mind of malice and anger, causes a division between friends.

original: de ma yin te /
analyzed: de ma yin te /
translated: It is not like that.

original: de la kun nas mnar sems dang / khro ba'i sems med du zin kyang sems can de dag gi sdug pa dang / gces pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba de dag la kun nas mnar sems dang khro ba'i sems yod pa'i phyir de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de la kun nas mnar sems dang / khro ba'i sems med du zin kyang sems can de dag gi sdug pa dang / gces pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba de dag la kun nas mnar sems dang khro ba'i sems yod pa'i phyir de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Even though he does not have a mind of malice and anger toward them, he causes a division between friends because of a mind of malice and anger toward those sentient beings who are dear to them, who are cherished by them, who are loved by them, and who are pleasing to them.

original: de dag yun ring por mi bzod cing mi bde la sems mngon par mi dga' bar 'gyur bar bya'o snyam nas de dag gi mdza' bo de 'byed par byed pa de lta bu ni /
analyzed: de dag yun ring por mi bzod cing mi bde la sems mngon par mi dga' bar 'gyur bar bya'o snyam nas de dag gi mdza' bo de 'byed par byed pa de lta bu ni /
translated: He thinks, “I will make them suffer for a long time, I will make them unhappy, I will make their minds discontented.”

original: zhe sdang las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: zhe sdang las byung ba yin no //
translated: That is the kind that arises from hatred.

original: gti mug las byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gti mug las byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the kind that arises from delusion?

original: bram ze dag 'di skad du lug gsod pa dang / bya gag gsod pa dang / phag gsod pa dang / bya ba dang / rngon pa dang / chom rkun dang / gshed ma dang / btson rdzi dang / khyi sha can dang / ri bong rgyas 'chor ba de dag ni /
analyzed: bram ze dag 'di skad du lug gsod pa dang / bya gag gsod pa dang / phag gsod pa dang / bya ba dang / rngon pa dang / chom rkun dang / gshed ma dang / btson rdzi dang / khyi sha can dang / ri bong rgyas 'chor ba de dag ni /
translated: those who hunt birds,🔽those who hunt deer,🔽those who are thieves,🔽those who are executioners,🔽those who are jailers,🔽those who are butchers,

analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: ji srid du 'di dag lhan cig 'khod cing mthun pa de srid du bsod nams ma yin pa mang du 'phel bar 'gyur la /

analyzed: phyi na ni /

analyzed: de ltar mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: zhes zer te /
translated: This is what they say.🔽🔽

analyzed: las de la ci'ang mi 'ong bar lta zhing 'bras bu med par @390b lta la 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du smras te /
translated: They see that action as having no effect at all, as being fruitless. They see it in this way and say:

analyzed: sems can bdag la sdug pa dang / gtses pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba de dag la mkho ba dang / 'chang ba dang / longs spyod du 'gyur ro snyam nas de dag gi don du gzhan la tshig rtsub pos kun tu spyo bar byed de /
translated: “Those sentient beings who are dear to me, who are kind to me, who are pleasant and agreeable to me, will have what they need, will have possessions, and will have enjoyments.” For their sake, one scolds others with harsh words.🔽For example,

translated: it is like writing,🔽calculation,

translated: reckoning,

translated: But that is not so.🔽Even though they do not have a mind of malice and anger toward them, they scold those sentient beings with harsh words, thinking,

analyzed: tshig kyal pa ni /

original: rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: is of three kinds:

analyzed: chags pa las byung ba dang / zhe sdang las byung ba dang / gti mug las byung ba'o //
translated: 1. that which arises from attachment, 2. that which arises from hatred, and 3. that which arises from delusion.
