translated: What is frivolous speech that arises from attachment?

original: smras pa / ji ltar 'di na kha cig yo byad gang 'dod pa de'i rgyu dang / de'i rkyen gyis gzhan dag la tshig kyal pas 'drid par byed do //
analyzed: smras pa / ji ltar 'di na kha cig yo byad gang 'dod pa de'i rgyu dang / de'i rkyen gyis gzhan dag la tshig kyal pas 'drid par byed do //
translated: It is the act of deceiving others with frivolous speech in order to obtain goods and services.

original: de ma yin te /
analyzed: de ma yin te /
translated: It is not that.

original: bdag nyid mi 'dod du zin kyang de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: bdag nyid mi 'dod du zin kyang de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Even though one does not desire it, one thinks:

original: sems can bdag la sdug pa dang / gces pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba de dag la mkho pa dang / 'chang ba dang / de dag gi longs spyod du 'gyur ro snyam nas de dag gi don du gzhan la tshig kyal pas 'drid par byed do //
analyzed: sems can bdag la sdug pa dang / gces pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba de dag la mkho pa dang / 'chang ba dang / de dag gi longs spyod du 'gyur ro snyam nas de dag gi don du gzhan la tshig kyal pas 'drid par byed do //
translated: “Those sentient beings who are dear to me, who are cherished, who are loved, and who are pleasing to me will have the necessities, will have the enjoyments, and will have the means of enjoyment.” For their sake, one deceives others with frivolous speech.

original: yang na gzhan gyis de la 'di skad du khyod tshur shog la ming 'di zhes bya ba la tshig kyal pas brid cig dang / ngas khyod la 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig sbyin no //
analyzed: yang na gzhan gyis de la 'di skad du khyod tshur shog la ming 'di zhes bya ba la tshig kyal pas brid cig dang / ngas khyod la 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig sbyin no //
translated: Or else, someone else tells them, “Come here! You must flatter so-and-so with idle chatter, and I will give you such-and-such things.

original: 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig bya'o //
translated: I will do such-and-such for you.”

original: zhes bsgos nas de longs spyod de dag 'dod nas gzhan dag la tshig kyal pas 'brid par byed de /
analyzed: zhes bsgos nas de longs spyod de dag 'dod nas gzhan dag la tshig kyal pas 'brid par byed de /
translated: Then, desiring those enjoyments, they flatter others with idle chatter.

original: dper na / bud med skyes pa la rag las na tshig kyal pa mang du smra ba dang / skyes ba bud @392a *//
analyzed: dper na / bud med skyes pa la rag las na tshig kyal pa mang du smra ba dang / skyes ba bud @392a *//
translated: For example, when a woman is dependent on a man, she often speaks with idle chatter.

original: med la rag las na /
analyzed: med la rag las na /
translated: When a man is dependent on a woman,🔽he often speaks with idle chatter.

original: tshig kyal pa mang du smra ba lta bu dang / dper na /
analyzed: tshig kyal pa mang du smra ba lta bu dang / dper na /
translated: For example,

original: zlos gar mkhan dang / gar mkhan dang / bzhad gad dang / sgeg pa dang / smad tshong ma dang / smad tshong ma'i gtso mo dang / sgyu rtsal byed pa rnams kyis gzhan dag gi longs spyod dag 'dod nas gzhan dag la tshig kyal pa smra bar byed pa lta bu'am /
analyzed: zlos gar mkhan dang / gar mkhan dang / bzhad gad dang / sgeg pa dang / smad tshong ma dang / smad tshong ma'i gtso mo dang / sgyu rtsal byed pa rnams kyis gzhan dag gi longs spyod dag 'dod nas gzhan dag la tshig kyal pa smra bar byed pa lta bu'am /
translated: actors, dancers, jesters, buffoons, prostitutes, their madams, and artists, who speak idle words to others in order to obtain their wealth.

original: yang na sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa dbyangs dang sbyor ba la chags te /🔽chags pa las byung ba'i tshig kyal pa smra ba de lta bu ni /
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa dbyangs dang sbyor ba la chags te / chags pa las byung ba'i tshig kyal pa smra ba de lta bu ni /
translated: Or else, attached to the melody of the Buddha’s speech,🔽they speak idle words born of attachment.

original: chags pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: chags pa las byung ba yin no //
translated: Idle words born of attachment are like this.

original: tshig kyal pa zhe sdang las byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: tshig kyal pa zhe sdang las byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are idle words born of hatred?

original: smras pa / ji ltar 'di na kha cig gang la kun nas mnar sems dang / khro ba'i sems yod pa'i phyir de la tshig kyal pas 'drid par byed do //
analyzed: smras pa / ji ltar 'di na kha cig gang la kun nas mnar sems dang / khro ba'i sems yod pa'i phyir de la tshig kyal pas 'drid par byed do //
translated: For example, when someone, out of a mind of malice and anger, deceives another with idle words.

original: de ma yin te /
analyzed: de ma yin te /
translated: Or else,

original: de la kun nas mnar sems dang / khro ba'i sems med du zin kyang de de dag gi sems can sdug pa dang / gces pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba de dag la kun nas mnar sems dang / khro ba'i sems yod pa'i phyir de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de la kun nas mnar sems dang / khro ba'i sems med du zin kyang de de dag gi sems can sdug pa dang / gces pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba de dag la kun nas mnar sems dang / khro ba'i sems yod pa'i phyir de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: “Those sentient beings who are dear to them, who are cherished by them, who are loved by them, and who are pleasing to them, have a hostile and angry mind toward them.🔽I will make them have a mind that is not patient, not happy, and not delighted for a long time.”

original: de dag yun ring por mi bzod cing mi bde la sems mngon par mi dga' bar 'gyur bar bya'o snyam nas de dag la tshig kyal pas 'drid par byed pa de lta bu ni /
analyzed: de dag yun ring por mi bzod cing mi bde la sems mngon par mi dga' bar 'gyur bar bya'o snyam nas de dag la tshig kyal pas 'drid par byed pa de lta bu ni /
translated: He deceives them with frivolous speech.

original: zhe sdang las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: zhe sdang las byung ba yin no //
translated: This is the type of frivolous speech that arises from hatred.

original: tshig kyal pa gti mug las byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: tshig kyal pa gti mug las byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is frivolous speech that arises from delusion?

original: smras pa / bram ze dag 'di skad du /
analyzed: smras pa / bram ze dag 'di skad du /
translated: It is like the Brahmins who say,

original: mi ni / @392b mes dag par 'gyur ro //🔽grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi ni / @392b mes dag par 'gyur ro // grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “A person is purified by fire.🔽He is liberated.

original: nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He is released.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He transcends happiness and suffering.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba las 'das pa yang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba las 'das pa yang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will also attain the transcendence of pleasure and pain.

original: de bzhin du mchod sbyin dang / dka' thub ngan pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mchod sbyin dang / dka' thub ngan pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: In the same way, various kinds of bad sacrifices and austerities are like that.

original: zhes zer te /
analyzed: zhes zer te /
translated: They say:

original: las de la ci'ang mi 'ong bar lta zhing 'bras bu med par lta la /
analyzed: las de la ci'ang mi 'ong bar lta zhing 'bras bu med par lta la /
translated: “There is no result at all from that action. There is no result.

original: 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du smra ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du smra ste /
translated: They see it like this and speak like this:

original: las 'di med do //
analyzed: las 'di med do //
translated: ‘This action does not exist.

original: las 'di'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do //
analyzed: las 'di'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do //
translated: The result of this action does not exist.

original: zhes zer te /
analyzed: zhes zer te /
translated: They say:

original: gti mug las byung ba'i tshig kyal pa smra ba de lta bu ni /
analyzed: gti mug las byung ba'i tshig kyal pa smra ba de lta bu ni /
translated: This kind of idle chatter that arises from delusion

original: gti mug las byung ba yin no //🔽brnab sems ni /
analyzed: gti mug las byung ba yin no // brnab sems ni /
translated: arises from delusion.🔽Covetousness

original: rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: is of three kinds:

original: chags pa las byung ba dang / zhe sdang las byung ba dang / gti mug las byung ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa las byung ba dang / zhe sdang las byung ba dang / gti mug las byung ba'o //
translated: arising from attachment, arising from aversion, and arising from delusion.

original: brnab sems chags pa las byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: brnab sems chags pa las byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is covetousness arising from attachment?

original: smras pa / dper na /
analyzed: smras pa / dper na /
translated: It is like this:

original: chags pa'i kun nas dkris pa'i rjes thogs su brnab sems kyi kun nas dkris pa skyed par byed pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: chags pa'i kun nas dkris pa'i rjes thogs su brnab sems kyi kun nas dkris pa skyed par byed pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, immediately after the fetter of attachment, the fetter of covetousness arises.

original: 'di ni / brnab sems chags pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni / brnab sems chags pa las byung ba yin no //
translated: This is covetousness that arises from attachment.

original: brnab sems zhe sdang las byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: brnab sems zhe sdang las byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is covetousness that arises from aversion?

original: smras pa / dper na /🔽zhe sdang gi kun nas dkris pa'i rjes thogs su brnab sems kyi kun nas dkris pa skyed par byed pa lta bu ste; 'di ni /
analyzed: smras pa / dper na / zhe sdang gi kun nas dkris pa'i rjes thogs su brnab sems kyi kun nas dkris pa skyed par byed pa lta bu ste; 'di ni /
translated: It is like the following.🔽Immediately after the fetter of aversion, the fetter of covetousness arises.

original: brnab sems zhe sdang las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: brnab sems zhe sdang las byung ba yin no //
translated: This is covetousness that arises from aversion.

original: brnab sems gti mug las byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: brnab sems gti mug las byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is covetousness that arises from delusion?

original: smras pa / dper na /
analyzed: smras pa / dper na /
translated: It is like the following.

original: gti mug gi kun nas dkris pa'i rjes thogs su brnab sems @393a *//🔽kyi kun nas dkris pa skyed par byed pa lta bu ste /🔽'di ni / gti mug las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gti mug gi kun nas dkris pa'i rjes thogs su brnab sems @393a *// kyi kun nas dkris pa skyed par byed pa lta bu ste / 'di ni / gti mug las byung ba yin no //
translated: Immediately after the fetter of delusion, the fetter of covetousness arises.

original: gnod sems ni /
analyzed: gnod sems ni /
translated: This is covetousness that arises from delusion.🔽What is malice?

original: rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is threefold:

original: chags pa las byung ba dang / zhe sdang las byung ba dang / gti mug las byung ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa las byung ba dang / zhe sdang las byung ba dang / gti mug las byung ba'o //
translated: arisen from delusion.

original: gnod sems chags pa las byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnod sems chags pa las byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is malice arisen from attachment?”

original: smras pa / dper na /
analyzed: smras pa / dper na /
translated: It is like the following.

original: chags pa'i kun nas dkris pa'i rjes thogs su gnod sems kyi kun nas dkris pa skyed par byed pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: chags pa'i kun nas dkris pa'i rjes thogs su gnod sems kyi kun nas dkris pa skyed par byed pa lta bu ste /
translated: Immediately after the entanglements of attachment, the entanglements of malice arise.

original: 'di ni / chags pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / chags pa las byung ba'o //
translated: This is malice arisen from attachment.

original: gnod sems zhe sdang las byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnod sems zhe sdang las byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is malice arisen from aversion?”

original: smras pa / dper na /
analyzed: smras pa / dper na /
translated: It is like the following.

original: zhe sdang gi kun nas dkris pa'i rjes thogs su gnod sems kyi kun nas dkris pa skyed par byed pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi kun nas dkris pa'i rjes thogs su gnod sems kyi kun nas dkris pa skyed par byed pa lta bu ste /
translated: Immediately after the entanglements of aversion, the entanglements of malice arise.

original: 'di ni / zhe sdang las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni / zhe sdang las byung ba yin no //
translated: This is malice arisen from aversion.

original: gnod sems gti mug las byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnod sems gti mug las byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is malice arisen from delusion?”

original: smras pa; dper na /
analyzed: smras pa; dper na /
translated: It is like the following.

original: gti mug gi kun nas dkris pa'i rjes thogs su gnod sems kyi kun nas dkris pa skyed par byed pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: gti mug gi kun nas dkris pa'i rjes thogs su gnod sems kyi kun nas dkris pa skyed par byed pa lta bu ste /
translated: Immediately after the entanglements of delusion, the entanglements of malice arise.

original: 'di ni / gti mug las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / gti mug las byung ba'o //
translated: This is the one that arises from delusion.

original: log par lta ba ni; rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: log par lta ba ni; rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three types of wrong views:

original: chags pa las byung ba dang / zhe sdang las byung ba dang / gti mug las byung ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa las byung ba dang / zhe sdang las byung ba dang / gti mug las byung ba'o //
translated: those that arise from attachment, those that arise from aversion, and those that arise from delusion.

original: log par lta ba chags pa las byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: log par lta ba chags pa las byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is a wrong view that arises from attachment?”

original: smras pa / dper na /
analyzed: smras pa / dper na /
translated: It is like the following example:

original: chags pa kun nas dkris pa'i rjes thogs su log par lta ba'i kun nas dkris pa skyed par byed pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: chags pa kun nas dkris pa'i rjes thogs su log par lta ba'i kun nas dkris pa skyed par byed pa lta bu ste /
translated: immediately after the entanglements of attachment, the entanglements of wrong views arise.

original: 'di ni / chags pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / chags pa las byung ba'o //
translated: This is the one that arises from attachment.

original: log par lta ba zhe sdang las byung @393b ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: log par lta ba zhe sdang las byung @393b ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: “What is a wrong view that arises from aversion?”

original: smras pa / dper na /
analyzed: smras pa / dper na /
translated: It is like the following example:

original: zhe sdang gi kun nas dkris pa'i rjes thogs su log par lta ba'i kun nas dkris pa skyed par byed pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi kun nas dkris pa'i rjes thogs su log par lta ba'i kun nas dkris pa skyed par byed pa lta bu ste /
translated: immediately after the entanglements of aversion, the entanglements of wrong views arise.

original: 'di ni / zhe sdang las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni / zhe sdang las byung ba yin no //
translated: This is the one that arises from aversion.

original: log par lta ba gti mug las byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: log par lta ba gti mug las byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: “What is a wrong view that arises from delusion?”

original: smras pa / dper na /
analyzed: smras pa / dper na /
translated: It is like the following example:

original: gti mug gi kun nas dkris pa'i rjes thogs su log par lta ba'i kun nas dkris pa skyed par byed pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: gti mug gi kun nas dkris pa'i rjes thogs su log par lta ba'i kun nas dkris pa skyed par byed pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, after the envelopment of delusion, the envelopment of wrong views arises.

original: 'di ni; gti mug las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni; gti mug las byung ba'o //
translated: This is what arises from delusion.

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar te /🔽srog gcod pa ni /
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar te / srog gcod pa ni /
translated: “The ten unwholesome courses of action” should be expanded in detail.

original: rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: “Killing” is of three types:

original: chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'o //
analyzed: chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'o //
translated: small, medium, and great.

original: srog gcod pa chen po kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas ni /
analyzed: srog gcod pa chen po kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas ni /
translated: Through the great form of killing, which is cultivated, made a living experience, and repeatedly practiced,

original: lus dang bral te shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dang bral te shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: after separating from the body, one falls into the lower realms and is born among the hell beings.

original: srog gcod pa 'bring kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas ni /
analyzed: srog gcod pa 'bring kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas ni /
translated: Through the medium form of killing, which is cultivated, made a living experience, and repeatedly practiced,

original: lus dang bral te shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba dud 'gro rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dang bral te shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba dud 'gro rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: after separating from the body, one falls into the lower realms and is born among the animals.

original: srog gcod pa chung ngu kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas ni /
analyzed: srog gcod pa chung ngu kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas ni /
translated: becoming habituated with, and increasing small acts of killing,

original: lus dang bral te shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba yi dvags rnams dang skal pa mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dang bral te shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba yi dvags rnams dang skal pa mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: after separating from one’s body, one will fall into the lower realms and be reborn among the hungry ghosts.

original: ji ltar srog gcod pa rnam pa gsum yod pa de bzhin du ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du @394a *//
analyzed: ji ltar srog gcod pa rnam pa gsum yod pa de bzhin du ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du @394a *//
translated: Just as there are three degrees of killing, there are also three degrees of taking what is not given, sexual misconduct,🔽lying,🔽slander, harsh words, idle talk,

original: smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig kyal ba dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba la yang chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po yod de /
analyzed: smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig kyal ba dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba la yang chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po yod de /
translated: covetousness, ill will, and wrong views.🔽By relying on,

original: log par lta ba chen po kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas ni /
analyzed: log par lta ba chen po kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas ni /
translated: becoming habituated with, and increasing great wrong views,

original: lus dang bral nas shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dang bral nas shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: after separating from one’s body, one will fall into the lower realms and be reborn in the hells.

original: log par lta ba 'bring kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas ni /
analyzed: log par lta ba 'bring kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas ni /
translated: wrong views of medium strength,

original: lus dang bral te shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba dud 'gro rnams dang skal pa mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dang bral te shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba dud 'gro rnams dang skal pa mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: after separating from the body, you will fall to the lower realms and be reborn with the same fate as animals.🔽By relying on,🔽becoming habituated with, and increasing

original: log par lta ba chung ngu kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas ni /
analyzed: log par lta ba chung ngu kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas ni /
translated: wrong views of lesser strength,

original: lus dang bral te shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba yi dvags khams dang skal pa mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dang bral te shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba yi dvags khams dang skal pa mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: after separating from the body, you will fall to the lower realms and be reborn with the same fate as the hungry ghosts.

original: las gdags pa tshigs gsum pa'o ////
analyzed: las gdags pa tshigs gsum pa'o ////
translated: This concludes the third chapter, on karma, of this Ornament of Precious Liberation, a Wish-­Fulfilling Gem of Sublime Dharma.🔽The summary verses:🔽The small, the medium, the great,🔽and the way they are divided into parts,🔽the inclusion of misdeeds,

original: sdom ni / chung dang 'bring dang chen po dang // cha shas ji ltar gse ba dang // nyes par spyod pas bsdus pa dang // chos gsum dag dang ldan cig 'byung //
analyzed: sdom ni / chung dang 'bring dang chen po dang // cha shas ji ltar gse ba dang // nyes par spyod pas bsdus pa dang // chos gsum dag dang ldan cig 'byung //
translated: and the arising of the three factors.

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar te srog gcod pa ni /🔽rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar te srog gcod pa ni /🔽rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The ten nonvirtuous actions are as follows. Killing is of three types:

original: chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'o //
analyzed: chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'o //
translated: small, medium, and great.

original: srog gcod pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen por ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: srog gcod pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen por ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one understand small, medium, and great killing?

original: smras pa / so so'i rgyu las srog @394b gcod pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen por shes par bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / so so'i rgyu las srog @394b gcod pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen por shes par bya'o //
translated: It is said: One should understand small, medium, and great killing from the individual causes.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: smras pa / kun nas dkris pa chung ngus kun nas dkris te srog chags kyi srog gcod par byed na ni /
analyzed: smras pa / kun nas dkris pa chung ngus kun nas dkris te srog chags kyi srog gcod par byed na ni /
translated: It is said: If one kills a living being with a small fetter,

original: rnam par smin pa chung ngur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa chung ngur 'gyur ro //
translated: the maturation will be small.

original: kun nas dkris pa 'bring dang / chen pos kun nas dkris te srog chags kyi srog gcod par byed na ni /
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa 'bring dang / chen pos kun nas dkris te srog chags kyi srog gcod par byed na ni /
translated: If one kills a living being with a medium or great fetter,

original: rnam par smin pa 'bring dang / chen por 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa 'bring dang / chen por 'gyur te /
translated: the maturation will be medium or great.

original: dper na / dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa gnyis shig srog chags kyi srog gcod par byed la /🔽de gnyi ga yang pha yang ma yin /
analyzed: dper na / dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa gnyis shig srog chags kyi srog gcod par byed la / de gnyi ga yang pha yang ma yin /
translated: For example, two people who have cut the roots of virtue kill a living being.

original: ma yang ma yin na /
analyzed: ma yang ma yin na /
translated: Both are neither father nor mother.🔽Nor are they mothers.

original: gang kha na ma tho ba chen po 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang kha na ma tho ba chen po 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Which one will have the greater offense?

original: smras pa / gang kun nas dkris pa ches che bas kun nas dkris te srog gcod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gang kun nas dkris pa ches che bas kun nas dkris te srog gcod par byed pa'o //
translated: He said, “The one who kills with a very great entanglement.

original: kun nas dkris pa mnyam pa'i ni /
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa mnyam pa'i ni /
translated: The one who kills with an equal entanglement

original: rnam par smin pa yang mnyam mo //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa yang mnyam mo //
translated: has an equal maturation.🔽If one kills one’s father

original: gcig ni / pha'am /🔽ma yin na /
analyzed: gcig ni / pha'am / ma yin na /
translated: or one’s mother,

original: gang kha na ma tho ba ches che bar 'gyur zhe na /🔽smras pa / pha'am /
analyzed: gang kha na ma tho ba ches che bar 'gyur zhe na / smras pa / pha'am /
translated: which is a greater offense?

original: ma gang yin pa'o //🔽gnyi ga pha'am /
analyzed: ma gang yin pa'o // gnyi ga pha'am /
translated: He said, “The one who kills his father

original: ma yin na /
analyzed: ma yin na /
translated: or his mother.🔽If both are one’s father or both are one’s mother,

original: gang kha na ma tho ba ches che bar 'gyur zhe na /🔽smras pa / gang kun nas dkris pa ches che bas kun nas dkris te srog gcod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang kha na ma tho ba ches che bar 'gyur zhe na / smras pa / gang kun nas dkris pa ches che bas kun nas dkris te srog gcod par byed pa'o //
translated: which is a greater offense?🔽He said, “The one who kills with a very great entanglement.

original: kun nas dkris pa mnyam pa'i ni /
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa mnyam pa'i ni /
translated: The one who kills with an equal entanglement

original: rnam par smin pa yang mnyam pa lta bu'o /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa yang mnyam pa lta bu'o /
translated: has an equal maturation.

original: dper na / dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa ma yin pa gnyis shig srog chags kyi srog gcod par byed la de gnyi ga pha yang ma yin ma yang ma yin na /
analyzed: dper na / dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa ma yin pa gnyis shig srog chags kyi srog gcod par byed la de gnyi ga pha yang ma yin ma yang ma yin na /
translated: For example, if two people who have not cut the wholesome roots kill a living being, and neither of them is a father or a mother,

original: gang kha na ma tho ba ches che bar 'gyur zhe @395a *//
analyzed: gang kha na ma tho ba ches che bar 'gyur zhe @395a *//
translated: which is a greater offense?

original: na; smras pa /
analyzed: na; smras pa /
translated: Vimalakīrti replied, “

original: gang ches dge ba'i chos can yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang ches dge ba'i chos can yin pa'o //
translated: He who is endowed with the most virtuous qualities.

original: gnyi ga chos can du mnyam na gang ches kha na ma tho ba chen por 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gnyi ga chos can du mnyam na gang ches kha na ma tho ba chen por 'gyur zhe na /
translated: ” “If both are equal in virtuous qualities, who is the most sinful?🔽”

original: smras pa / gang kun nas dkris pa chen pos kun nas dkris te srog gcod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gang kun nas dkris pa chen pos kun nas dkris te srog gcod par byed pa'o //
translated: “He who kills with the greatest mental affliction.

original: kun nas dkris pa mnyam pa'i ni /
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa mnyam pa'i ni /
translated: ” “If both are equal in mental affliction,

original: rnam par smin pa yang mnyam mo //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa yang mnyam mo //
translated: their retribution will be equal.

original: gcig ni / pha'am ma yin na /
analyzed: gcig ni / pha'am ma yin na /
translated: ” “If one kills one’s father, and the other kills one who is both father and a perfected being,🔽who is the most sinful?

original: gang kha na ma tho ba ches che bar 'gyur zhe na /🔽smras pa / pha'am ma gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang kha na ma tho ba ches che bar 'gyur zhe na / smras pa / pha'am ma gang yin pa'o //
translated: What is the most heinous sin?🔽It is to kill one’s father or mother.🔽

original: gnyi ga pha'am ma yin na /
analyzed: gnyi ga pha'am ma yin na /
translated: “He who kills the one who is both father and a perfected being.🔽” “If both kill those who are both father and a perfected being,

original: gang kha na ma tho ba ches che bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang kha na ma tho ba ches che bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: who is the most sinful?🔽”

original: smras pa / gang ches dge ba'i chos can yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gang ches dge ba'i chos can yin pa'o //
translated: “He who is endowed with the most virtuous qualities.

original: gnyi ga chos can du mnyam na /
analyzed: gnyi ga chos can du mnyam na /
translated: ” “If both are equal in virtuous qualities,

original: gang ches kha na ma tho ba chen por 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang ches kha na ma tho ba chen por 'gyur zhe na /
translated: who is the most sinful?🔽”🔽“He who kills with the greatest mental affliction.

original: smras pa / gang kun nas dkris pa chen pos kun nas dkris te srog gcod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gang kun nas dkris pa chen pos kun nas dkris te srog gcod par byed pa'o //
translated: He said, “One who kills with a great entanglement.”🔽

original: kun nas dkris pa mnyam pa'i ni /
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa mnyam pa'i ni /
translated: The equalizing fetter is🔽

original: rnam par smin pa yang mnyam pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa yang mnyam pa lta bu'o //
translated: The maturation of the equal envelopment is equal.

original: srog gcod pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig kyal ba dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang /
analyzed: srog gcod pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig kyal ba dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang /
translated: Just as with killing, so too with taking what is not given, sexual misconduct, false speech, slander, harsh speech, frivolous speech, covetousness, ill will,🔽and wrong view.

original: log par lta ba rnams kyang de bzhin du sbyar ro; ;mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar te /🔽nyes par spyod pa ni /
analyzed: log par lta ba rnams kyang de bzhin du sbyar ro; ;mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar te / nyes par spyod pa ni /
translated: The ten unwholesome courses of action are explained in detail.

original: rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Misconduct is of three kinds:🔽misconduct of body, misconduct of speech, and misconduct of mind.

original: lus kyis nyes par spyod pa dang / ngag gis nyes par spyod pa dang / @395b yid kyis nyes par spyod pa dang / ci mi dge ba bcu'i las rnams kyis nyes par spyod pa gsum bsdus sam /
analyzed: lus kyis nyes par spyod pa dang / ngag gis nyes par spyod pa dang / @395b yid kyis nyes par spyod pa dang / ci mi dge ba bcu'i las rnams kyis nyes par spyod pa gsum bsdus sam /
translated: Are the three kinds of misconduct included in the ten unwholesome courses of action,

original: 'on te gsum gyis bcu bsdus she na /
analyzed: 'on te gsum gyis bcu bsdus she na /
translated: or are the ten included in the three?

original: smras pa / gsum gyis bcu bsdus kyi /
analyzed: smras pa / gsum gyis bcu bsdus kyi /
translated: It is said: The ten are included in the three,🔽but the three are not included in the ten.

original: bcus ni / gsum ma bsdus so //
analyzed: bcus ni / gsum ma bsdus so //
translated: The three are not included in the ten.

original: gang ma bsdus she na /
analyzed: gang ma bsdus she na /
translated: What are they?

original: smras pa / lus kyis nyes par spyod pa dang / ngag gis nyes par spyod pa dang / yid kyis nyes par spyod pa ma bsdus so //🔽lus kyis nyes par spyod pa ni /
analyzed: smras pa / lus kyis nyes par spyod pa dang / ngag gis nyes par spyod pa dang / yid kyis nyes par spyod pa ma bsdus so // lus kyis nyes par spyod pa ni /
translated: It is said: The three kinds of bodily misconduct, the three kinds of verbal misconduct, and the three kinds of mental misconduct are not included.

original: rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Bodily misconduct is of three kinds:

original: srog chags gsod pa dang / ma byin pa len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa'o //🔽ci lus kyi nyes par spyod pa rnam pa gsum gyis lus kyi nyes par spyod pa thams cad bsdus sam /
analyzed: srog chags gsod pa dang / ma byin pa len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa'o // ci lus kyi nyes par spyod pa rnam pa gsum gyis lus kyi nyes par spyod pa thams cad bsdus sam /
translated: killing, taking what is not given, and sexual misconduct.🔽Are all kinds of bodily misconduct included in the three kinds of bodily misconduct?

original: 'on te thams cad kyis rnam pa gsum bsdus she na /🔽smras pa / lus kyis nyes par spyod pa thams cad kyis lus kyi nyes par spyod pa rnam pa gsum bsdus kyi /🔽rnam pa gsum gyis ni /
analyzed: 'on te thams cad kyis rnam pa gsum bsdus she na / smras pa / lus kyis nyes par spyod pa thams cad kyis lus kyi nyes par spyod pa rnam pa gsum bsdus kyi / rnam pa gsum gyis ni /
translated: Or are the three kinds of bodily misconduct included in all kinds of bodily misconduct?🔽It is said: All kinds of bodily misconduct are included in the three kinds of bodily misconduct.

original: thams cad ma bsdus so //
analyzed: thams cad ma bsdus so //
translated: But the three kinds of bodily misconduct do not include all kinds of bodily misconduct.

original: gang ma bsdus she na /
analyzed: gang ma bsdus she na /
translated: What are they?

original: smras pa / lag pa dang / khu tshur dang / thal lcag gis bsnun pa dang / yal ga dang lcug mas gnod par bya ba dang ldan pa'i lus kyi las dang / 'bru'i chang dang 'bras bu'i chang 'thung ba dang / brku ba'i sems kyis rang gi rdzas khyer ba dang /🔽brjed ngas pa dang shes bzhin med pas kha zas za ba'i lus kyi las gang yin pa dang / bdag gi chung ma la log par 'jug pa dang / phyogs gang na tshul khrims 'chal @396a *//
analyzed: smras pa / lag pa dang / khu tshur dang / thal lcag gis bsnun pa dang / yal ga dang lcug mas gnod par bya ba dang ldan pa'i lus kyi las dang / 'bru'i chang dang 'bras bu'i chang 'thung ba dang / brku ba'i sems kyis rang gi rdzas khyer ba dang / brjed ngas pa dang shes bzhin med pas kha zas za ba'i lus kyi las gang yin pa dang / bdag gi chung ma la log par 'jug pa dang / phyogs gang na tshul khrims 'chal @396a *//
translated: He said: “It is the physical action of striking with the hand, fist, or whip, and of harming with sticks and clods; drinking alcohol made from grain or fruit; taking one’s own property with a thieving mind;

original: ba'i skyes bu gang zag rnams 'khod pa de yongs su ma spangs pa dang ldan pa'i lus kyi las so //🔽ngag gi nyes par spyod pa ni /
analyzed: ba'i skyes bu gang zag rnams 'khod pa de yongs su ma spangs pa dang ldan pa'i lus kyi las so // ngag gi nyes par spyod pa ni /
translated: the physical action of eating food with forgetfulness and lack of awareness; engaging in sexual intercourse with one’s own wife; and not avoiding a place where people with faulty moral discipline are staying.

original: rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Verbal misconduct is of four types:

original: brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa'o //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa'o //
translated: lying, slander, harsh words, and idle talk.

original: ci ngag gis nyes par spyod pa rnam pa bzhis ngag gi nyes par spyod pa thams cad bsdus sam /
analyzed: ci ngag gis nyes par spyod pa rnam pa bzhis ngag gi nyes par spyod pa thams cad bsdus sam /
translated: Are all verbal misdeeds included in the four types of verbal misdeeds?

original: 'on te thams cad kyis rnam pa bzhi bsdus she na /
analyzed: 'on te thams cad kyis rnam pa bzhi bsdus she na /
translated: Or are the four types of verbal misdeeds included in all [verbal misdeeds]?

original: smras pa / ngag gi nyes par spyod pa thams cad kyis ngag gi nyes par spyod pa bzhi bsdus kyi /
analyzed: smras pa / ngag gi nyes par spyod pa thams cad kyis ngag gi nyes par spyod pa bzhi bsdus kyi /
translated: It is said: All verbal misdeeds are included in the four types of verbal misdeeds.

original: rnam pa bzhis ni /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhis ni /
translated: But the four types of verbal misdeeds

original: thams cad ma bsdus so //
analyzed: thams cad ma bsdus so //
translated: do not include all [verbal misdeeds].

original: gang ma bsdus she na /
analyzed: gang ma bsdus she na /
translated: What are not included?

original: smras pa / 'di ltar gcig pu dben pa na gnas shing tshig tu smras te /🔽sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: smras pa / 'di ltar gcig pu dben pa na gnas shing tshig tu smras te / sbyin pa med do //
translated: It is said: Thus, while dwelling alone in solitude, one speaks words such as:🔽There is no generosity.

original: mchod sbyin med do //
analyzed: mchod sbyin med do //
translated: There is no sacrifice.

original: sbyin sreg med do //
analyzed: sbyin sreg med do //
translated: There is no burnt offering.

original: legs par spyad pa med do //
analyzed: legs par spyad pa med do //
translated: There is no good conduct.

original: nyes par spyad pa med do //
analyzed: nyes par spyad pa med do //
translated: There is no bad conduct.

original: legs par spyad pa dang / nyes par spyad pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do //
analyzed: legs par spyad pa dang / nyes par spyad pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do //
translated: There are no results or consequences of good or bad conduct.

original: 'jig rten 'di med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di med do //
translated: This world does not exist.

original: 'jig rten pha rol med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol med do //
translated: The other world does not exist.

original: pha med do; ;ma med do //
analyzed: pha med do; ;ma med do //
translated: There is no father.

original: sems can skye ba med do //
analyzed: sems can skye ba med do //
translated: There are no sentient beings who are born.

original: 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa yang dag par song ba /
analyzed: 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa yang dag par song ba /
translated: In the world, there are arhats who have truly gone,

original: yang dag par zhugs pa gang 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol tshe 'di nyid la bdag nyid kyi mngon par shes pas mngon sum du byas te bsgrubs nas khong du chud de bdag cag gi skye ba zad do //
analyzed: yang dag par zhugs pa gang 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol tshe 'di nyid la bdag nyid kyi mngon par shes pas mngon sum du byas te bsgrubs nas khong du chud de bdag cag gi skye ba zad do //
translated: who have truly entered, who have attained the direct perception of their own higher knowledge in this very life, and who have accomplished and realized it for themselves. They think, “Our births have been exhausted.

original: tshangs par spyad pa bsten to //
analyzed: tshangs par spyad pa bsten to //
translated: We have lived the holy life.

original: bya ba byas so //🔽'di las srid pa @396b gzhan mi shes so snyam du sems pa med do //
analyzed: bya ba byas so // 'di las srid pa @396b gzhan mi shes so snyam du sems pa med do //
translated: We have done what had to be done.🔽We will know no other existence than this one.”

original: zhes zer ba'o //🔽yid kyi nyes par spyod pa ni /
analyzed: zhes zer ba'o // yid kyi nyes par spyod pa ni /
translated: There is no such thought.

original: rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of mental misconduct:

original: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba'o //🔽ci yid kyi nyes par spyod pa rnam pa gsum gyis yid kyi nyes par spyod pa thams cad bsdus sam /
analyzed: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba'o // ci yid kyi nyes par spyod pa rnam pa gsum gyis yid kyi nyes par spyod pa thams cad bsdus sam /
translated: covetousness, ill will, and wrong views.🔽Are all mental misdeeds included in the three kinds of mental misconduct,

original: 'on te thams cad kyis rnam pa gsum bsdus she na /
analyzed: 'on te thams cad kyis rnam pa gsum bsdus she na /
translated: or are the three kinds of mental misconduct included in all mental misdeeds?

original: smras pa / yid kyi nyes par spyod pa thams cad kyis yid kyi nyes par spyod pa rnam pa gsum bsdus kyi /
analyzed: smras pa / yid kyi nyes par spyod pa thams cad kyis yid kyi nyes par spyod pa rnam pa gsum bsdus kyi /
translated: He said, “All mental misconduct is included in the three types of mental misconduct.

original: rnam pa gsum gyis ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum gyis ni /
translated: But the three types

original: thams cad ma bsdus so //
analyzed: thams cad ma bsdus so //
translated: do not include all of them.

original: gang ma bsdus she na /
analyzed: gang ma bsdus she na /
translated: What is not included?

original: smras pa / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba dang ldan pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'o //🔽lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos ni /
analyzed: smras pa / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba dang ldan pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'o // lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos ni /
translated: He said, “The feelings, perceptions, volitions, contacts, mental activities, and consciousness that are associated with covetousness, ill will, and wrong views.

original: gsum yod do //
analyzed: gsum yod do //
translated: There are three dharmas that occur together:

original: chags pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams dang / zhe sdang dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams dang / gti mug dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: chags pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams dang / zhe sdang dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams dang / gti mug dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: the dharmas that occur together with attachment, the dharmas that occur together with anger, and the dharmas that occur together with ignorance.

original: chags pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: chags pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the dharmas that occur together with attachment?

original: smras pa / chags pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / chags pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang /
analyzed: smras pa / chags pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / chags pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang /
translated: He replied, “They are physical and verbal actions that arise together with attachment, and the feelings, perceptions, volitions, contacts, mental attentions,

original: rnam par shes pa ste /🔽'di dag ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ste / 'di dag ni /
translated: and consciousnesses that are associated with attachment.

original: chags pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //🔽zhe sdang dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / gti @397a *//
analyzed: chags pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams zhes bya'o // zhe sdang dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / gti @397a *//
translated: These are called the phenomena that arise together with attachment.

original: mug dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: mug dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the phenomena that arise together with aversion and delusion?”

original: smras pa / zhe sdang dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / gti mug dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / zhe sdang dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / gti mug dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i tshor ba dang /
analyzed: smras pa / zhe sdang dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / gti mug dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / zhe sdang dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / gti mug dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i tshor ba dang /
translated: He replied, “They are physical and verbal actions that arise together with aversion and delusion, and the feelings, perceptions, volitions, contacts, mental attentions,

original: 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: and consciousnesses that are associated with aversion and delusion.

original: 'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'di dag ni /
translated: These are:

original: zhe sdang dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / gti mug dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / gti mug dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: the factors that arise together with aversion and the factors that arise together with delusion.

original: las gdags pa tshigs bzhi pa'o ////

analyzed: sdang dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / gti mug dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa ste /
translated: “The feeling, perception, intention, contact, and attention that arise together with aversion and the feeling, perception, intention, contact, and attention that arise together with delusion.

original: 'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'di dag ni /
translated: These are

original: sems las byung ba'o //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'o //
translated: the mental factors.”

original: sems las byung ba ma yin pa gang dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: sems las byung ba ma yin pa gang dag yin zhe na /
translated: “Which are not mental factors?”

original: smras pa / zhe sdang dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / gti mug dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / sems te /
analyzed: smras pa / zhe sdang dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / gti mug dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / sems te /
translated: He replied: “The bodily and verbal actions that arise together with aversion and the bodily and verbal actions that arise together with delusion, and the mind.

original: 'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'di dag ni /
translated: These are

original: sems las byung ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems las byung ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: not mental factors.”

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar te /
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar te /
translated: “The ten unwholesome courses of action” and so on.

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gang yin pa de dag las /
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gang yin pa de dag las /
translated: “From among these ten unwholesome courses of action,

original: du zhig las kyang yin la /
analyzed: du zhig las kyang yin la /
translated: how many are also actions?

original: las kyi lam yang yin /🔽du zhig las kyi lam ni /🔽yin la / las ni /
analyzed: las kyi lam yang yin / du zhig las kyi lam ni / yin la / las ni /
translated: They are also karmic paths.

original: ma yin zhe na smras pa /🔽bdun ni / las kyang yin la /
analyzed: ma yin zhe na smras pa / bdun ni / las kyang yin la /
translated: How many are karmic paths but not karma?

original: las kyi lam yang yin te /
analyzed: las kyi lam yang yin te /
translated: Seven are both karma and karmic paths.

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa rnams so //🔽gsum ni / las kyi lam yin la /
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa rnams so // gsum ni / las kyi lam yin la /
translated: Killing, taking what is not given, sexual misconduct, false speech, divisive speech, harsh speech and idle speech are both karma and karmic paths.

original: las ni / ma yin te /
analyzed: las ni / ma yin te /
translated: Three are karmic paths but not karma.

original: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba rnams so; ;ci'i phyir las kyang yin la /
analyzed: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba rnams so; ;ci'i phyir las kyang yin la /
translated: Covetousness, harmful intent and wrong view are karmic paths but not karma.

original: las kyi lam yang yin zhe na /🔽smras pa / srog gcod pa'i las ni /
analyzed: las kyi lam yang yin zhe na / smras pa / srog gcod pa'i las ni /
translated: Why are they both karma and karmic paths?

original: da ltar de byed pa yang yin la /
analyzed: da ltar de byed pa yang yin la /
translated: Killing is karma because it is the action of killing.

original: srog gcod pas kun nas bslang ba'i sems @400b pa rnams kyi lam dang / bgrod pa dang / srang yang yin te /🔽rgyu des na srog gcod pa las kyang yin la /
analyzed: srog gcod pas kun nas bslang ba'i sems @400b pa rnams kyi lam dang / bgrod pa dang / srang yang yin te / rgyu des na srog gcod pa las kyang yin la /
translated: It is a karmic path because it is the path, the passage and the way of those minds motivated by killing.

original: las kyi lam yang yin no //
analyzed: las kyi lam yang yin no //
translated: For that reason, killing is both karma and a karmic path.

original: srog gcod pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as with killing, so it is with taking what is not given, sexual misconduct, lying, slander, harsh speech, and idle talk.

original: ci'i phyir brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba las kyi lam yin la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba las kyi lam yin la /
translated: Why are covetousness, ill will, and wrong views not karmic paths?

original: las ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: las ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they not karma?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba ni /
analyzed: smras pa / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba ni /
translated: Covetousness, ill will, and wrong views

original: las kyang ma yin /
analyzed: las kyang ma yin /
translated: are neither karma nor its instigation.

original: byed pa yang ma yin gyi; brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta bas kun nas bslang ba'i sems las byung ba rnams kyi lam dang / bgrod pa dang / srang yin te /
analyzed: byed pa yang ma yin gyi; brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta bas kun nas bslang ba'i sems las byung ba rnams kyi lam dang / bgrod pa dang / srang yin te /
translated: They are the path, the passage, and the way of the mental factors that are motivated by covetousness, ill will, and wrong views.

original: rgyu des na brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba las kyi lam yin la /
analyzed: rgyu des na brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba las kyi lam yin la /
translated: For this reason, covetousness, ill will, and wrong views are karmic paths,

original: las ma yin no //
analyzed: las ma yin no //
translated: but they are not karma.

original: yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten vows of one who is not perfectly restrained?

original: bcu ni / srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang /
analyzed: bcu ni / srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang /
translated: The ten are: killing, taking what is not given, sexual misconduct, lying, slander, harsh speech, idle talk, covetousness, malice,

original: log par lta ba rnams so //
analyzed: log par lta ba rnams so //
translated: and wrong views.

original: de'i phyir srog gcod pa yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir srog gcod pa yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa yin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, killing is the non-restraint of killing.

original: smras pa / rnam par rig byed kyis dmigs pa las yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: smras pa / rnam par rig byed kyis dmigs pa las yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is said: Because of the non-restraint of the object of the intimation.

original: @401a *// ma spangs pas na /
analyzed: @401a *// ma spangs pas na /
translated: Because it is not abandoned,

original: 'dod pa'i khams thams cad yang dag par ma bsdams pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams thams cad yang dag par ma bsdams pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: it should be said that the entire realm of desire is non-restraint.

original: srog gcod pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as with killing, so it is with taking what is not given, sexual misconduct, lying, slander, harsh speech, and idle talk.

original: ci'i phyir brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why are covetousness, malice, and wrong views also called “non-restraint”?🔽It is said: Because of the entanglements, one is not restrained with regard to the objects.

original: smras pa / kun nas dkris pas dmigs pa rnams la yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i phyir te; ma spangs pas na thams cad du yang dag par ma bsdams pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / kun nas dkris pas dmigs pa rnams la yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i phyir te; ma spangs pas na thams cad du yang dag par ma bsdams pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Since they are not abandoned, they should be called “non-restraint in all ways.”

original: las gdags pa'i tshigs lnga pa'o ////
analyzed: las gdags pa'i tshigs lnga pa'o ////
translated: This is the fifth chapter on the designation of action.

original: sdom ni / yang dag ma bsdams bcu bstan dang // de yi sgo nas rnam lngar bcad //
analyzed: sdom ni / yang dag ma bsdams bcu bstan dang // de yi sgo nas rnam lngar bcad //

analyzed: yang dag ma bsdams sdom min bcu //

analyzed: sdom pa ma yin gsum po dang // de yi sgo nas rnam pa lnga // srog gcod pa nas log par lta ba'i bar du sdom pa ma yin pa yang yin la /

original: las kyang yin pa yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: las kyang yin pa yod dam zhe na /

original: smras pa / yod de /
analyzed: smras pa / yod de /

analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa'o // sdom pa ma yin pa yin la /
translated: Taking life, taking what is not given, sexual misconduct, false speech, malicious speech, harsh speech, and frivolous speech.

analyzed: las ni / ma yin pa yod dam zhe na /
translated: Is there non-restraint that is not action?

original: smras pa / yod de /
analyzed: smras pa / yod de /

analyzed: ma yin pa yod dam zhe na /

analyzed: smras pa / yod de /

analyzed: sdom min rnams ni lnga dang dgu /

analyzed: bco lnga dang ni dgu bcu brgyad // yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa ni /

analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
