analyzed: smras pa / lus kyi sgo nas rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / ngag gi sgo nas rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / yid kyi sgo nas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
translated: They are non-informative form and non-informative form that arise from the body, non-informative form and non-informative form that arise from speech, and non-informative form that arises from the mind.

original: gzhan yang yang dag par ma @404b bsdams pa'i sdom pa lnga yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang yang dag par ma @404b bsdams pa'i sdom pa lnga yod de /
translated: There are also five types of vows that are not fully restrained.

original: lus kyi sgo nas thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / thogs pa med pa dang / ngag gi sgo nas thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / thogs pa med pa dang / yid kyi sgo nas thogs pa med do //
analyzed: lus kyi sgo nas thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / thogs pa med pa dang / ngag gi sgo nas thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / thogs pa med pa dang / yid kyi sgo nas thogs pa med do //
translated: They are: (1) that which is restrained by the body but not by speech, (2) that which is restrained by speech but not by the body, (3) that which is restrained by both the body and speech, (4) that which is restrained by neither the body nor speech, and (5) that which is restrained by the mind but not by the body or speech.

original: gzhan yang yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa lnga yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa lnga yod de /
translated: There are also five types of non-vows that are not fully restrained.

original: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / thogs pa med pa dang / gzugs dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / thogs pa med pa dang / gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / thogs pa med pa dang / gzugs dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / thogs pa med pa dang / gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: They are: (1) that which is associated with desire and is restrained by the body but not by speech, (2) that which is associated with desire and is restrained by speech but not by the body, (3) that which is associated with desire and is restrained by both the body and speech, (4) that which is associated with form and is restrained by the body but not by speech, and (5) that which is associated with the formless realm and is restrained by the mind but not by the body or speech.

original: gzhan yang yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa lnga yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa lnga yod de /
translated: There are also five types of non-vows that are not fully restrained.

original: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / gzugs dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / gzugs dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
translated: and non-revealing form concomitant with the formless realm.🔽Non-restraint is of six types:🔽non-restraint concomitant with the desire realm,🔽non-restraint concomitant with the form realm,

original: yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa ni /
translated: and non-restraint concomitant with the formless realm.

original: drug yod de /🔽'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba dang / sems las byung ba ma yin pa dang / gzugs dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba dang / sems las byung ba ma yin pa dang / gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba dang /
analyzed: drug yod de / 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba dang / sems las byung ba ma yin pa dang / gzugs dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba dang / sems las byung ba ma yin pa dang / gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba dang /
translated: There are also six types of non-restraint:🔽non-restraint concomitant with the desire realm that is a mental factor,🔽non-restraint concomitant with the desire realm that is not a mental factor,🔽non-restraint concomitant with the form realm that is a mental factor,

original: sems las byung ba ma yin pa'o //🔽gzhan yang @405a *//
analyzed: sems las byung ba ma yin pa'o // gzhan yang @405a *//
translated: non-restraint concomitant with the form realm that is not a mental factor,

original: yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa drug yod de /
analyzed: yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa drug yod de /
translated: non-restraint concomitant with the formless realm that is a mental factor,🔽and non-restraint concomitant with the formless realm that is not a mental factor.

original: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / sems dang mi ldan pa dang / gzugs dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / sems dang mi ldan pa dang / gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / sems dang mi ldan pa dang / gzugs dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / sems dang mi ldan pa dang / gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang /
translated: those who do not possess a mind, those who possess a mind associated with the formless realm,

original: sems dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: and those who do not possess a mind.

original: gzhan yang yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa drug yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa drug yod de /
translated: There are six other types of non-restraint that are not fully restrained:

original: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / gzugs dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / gzugs dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang /
translated: those associated with the desire realm that have an object and those that do not have an object, those associated with the form realm that have an object and those that do not have an object, and those associated with the formless realm that have an object

original: dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: and those that do not have an object.

original: gzhan yang yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa drug yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa drug yod de /
translated: There are six other types of non-restraint that are not fully restrained:

original: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / sgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / gzugs dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / sgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang /🔽sgom pas spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / sgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / gzugs dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / sgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / sgom pas spang bar bya'o //
translated: The six types of nonrestraint are: nonrestraint concomitant with desire realm levels that is abandoned by the path of seeing, nonrestraint concomitant with desire realm levels that is abandoned by the path of meditation, nonrestraint concomitant with form realm levels that is abandoned by the path of seeing, nonrestraint concomitant with form realm levels that is abandoned by the path of meditation, nonrestraint concomitant with formless realm levels that is abandoned by the path of seeing, and nonrestraint concomitant with formless realm levels that is abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: gzhan yang yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa drug yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa drug yod de /
translated: There are also six types of nonrestraint that are not fully restrained:

original: mig gi sdom pa ma yin pa dang / @405b rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi sdom pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi sdom pa ma yin pa dang / @405b rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi sdom pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: nonrestraint of the eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: gang mig gi sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa de rna ba'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang yang ldan nam zhe na /
analyzed: gang mig gi sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa de rna ba'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang yang ldan nam zhe na /
translated: If one possesses nonrestraint of the eyes, does one also possess nonrestraint of the ears?

original: smras pa / de yin no; ;gang rna ba'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa de mig gi sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan nam zhe na /
analyzed: smras pa / de yin no; ;gang rna ba'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa de mig gi sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan nam zhe na /
translated: “Is one who possesses the restraint of the ear also one who possesses the non-restraint of the eye?”

original: smras pa / de yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / de yin no //
translated: He replied, “Yes.

original: mig gi sdom pa ma yin pa dang / rna ba'i sdom pa ma yin pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus kyi sdom pa ma yin pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mig gi sdom pa ma yin pa dang / rna ba'i sdom pa ma yin pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus kyi sdom pa ma yin pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as it is with the non-restraint of the eye and the ear, so it is with the non-restraint of the body.”

original: gang mig gi sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa de sna'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang yang ldan nam zhe na /
analyzed: gang mig gi sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa de sna'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang yang ldan nam zhe na /
translated: “Is one who possesses the non-restraint of the eye also one who possesses the non-restraint of the nose?”

original: smras pa / gang sna'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa de ni /
analyzed: smras pa / gang sna'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa de ni /
translated: He replied, “One who possesses the non-restraint of the nose

original: mig gi sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan no //
analyzed: mig gi sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan no //
translated: is also one who possesses the non-restraint of the eye.

original: mig gi sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan la sna'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang ni mi ldan pa yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: mig gi sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan la sna'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang ni mi ldan pa yod dam zhe na /
translated: “Is one who possesses the non-restraint of the eye not one who possesses the non-restraint of the nose?”🔽He replied, “Yes.

original: smras pa / yod de; dper na /🔽'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang bral la /🔽tshangs pa'i 'jig rten las ni /
analyzed: smras pa / yod de; dper na / 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang bral la / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten las ni /
translated: For example,🔽one who is free from attachment to the desire realm

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba lta bu'o //
translated: but is not free from attachment to the Brahma world.

original: mig gi sdom pa ma yin pa dang / sna'i sdom pa ma yin pa ji lta ba bzhin du lce'i sdom pa ma yin pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mig gi sdom pa ma yin pa dang / sna'i sdom pa ma yin pa ji lta ba bzhin du lce'i sdom pa ma yin pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as there is no restraint of the eyes and no restraint of the nose, so too there is no restraint of the tongue.

original: gang mig gi sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa de yid kyi sdom pa ma yin pa dang yang ldan nam zhe na /
analyzed: gang mig gi sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa de yid kyi sdom pa ma yin pa dang yang ldan nam zhe na /
translated: If one possesses the non-restraint of the eyes, does one also possess the non-restraint of the mind?

original: smras pa; gang mig gi sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa de ni /
analyzed: smras pa; gang mig gi sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa de ni /
translated: It is said: One who possesses the non-restraint of the eyes

original: yid kyi sdom pa ma yin pa dang yang ldan no //
analyzed: yid kyi sdom pa ma yin pa dang yang ldan no //
translated: also possesses the non-restraint of the mind.

original: yid kyi sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan la /
analyzed: yid kyi sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan la /
translated: But can one possess the non-restraint of the mind

original: mig gi sdom pa ma yin pa dang ni mi @406a *//🔽ldan pa yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: mig gi sdom pa ma yin pa dang ni mi @406a *// ldan pa yod dam zhe na /
translated: without possessing the non-restraint of the eyes?

original: smras pa / yod de /
analyzed: smras pa / yod de /
translated: It is said: Yes.

original: dper na / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten las 'dod chags dang bral la /
analyzed: dper na / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten las 'dod chags dang bral la /
translated: For example, one who is free from attachment to the Brahma world

original: gong ma'i 'dod chags dang ni ma bral ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gong ma'i 'dod chags dang ni ma bral ba lta bu'o //
translated: but is not free from attachment to the higher realms.

original: ji ltar mig gi sdom pa ma yin pa dang snga ma bzhin du sbyar ba de bzhin du rna ba dang / lus kyi sdom pa ma yin pa yang snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar mig gi sdom pa ma yin pa dang snga ma bzhin du sbyar ba de bzhin du rna ba dang / lus kyi sdom pa ma yin pa yang snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: Just as with the restraint of the eye sense faculty, the same should be applied to the restraint of the ear sense faculty and the restraint of the body sense faculty.

original: gang sna'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa de lce'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang yang ldan nam zhe na /
analyzed: gang sna'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa de lce'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang yang ldan nam zhe na /
translated: If one possesses the non-restraint of the nose sense faculty, does one also possess the non-restraint of the tongue sense faculty?

original: smras pa / de yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / de yin no //
translated: He says: That is so.

original: gang lce'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa de sna'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang yang ldan nam zhe na /
analyzed: gang lce'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa de sna'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang yang ldan nam zhe na /
translated: If one possesses the non-restraint of the tongue sense faculty, does one also possess the non-restraint of the nose sense faculty?

original: smras pa / de yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / de yin no //
translated: He says: That is so.

original: gang sna'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa de yid kyi sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan nam zhe na /
analyzed: gang sna'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa de yid kyi sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan nam zhe na /
translated: If one possesses the non-restraint of the nose sense faculty, does one also possess the non-restraint of the mind sense faculty?

original: smras pa / gang sna'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa de ni; yid kyi sdom pa ma yin pa dang yang ldan no //
analyzed: smras pa / gang sna'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa de ni; yid kyi sdom pa ma yin pa dang yang ldan no //
translated: He says: One who possesses the non-restraint of the nose sense faculty also possesses the non-restraint of the mind sense faculty.

original: yid kyi sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa de sna'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang mi ldan pa yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: yid kyi sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa de sna'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang mi ldan pa yod dam zhe na /
translated: Can one possess the non-restraint of the mind sense faculty without possessing the non-restraint of the nose sense faculty?

original: smras pa / yod de /
analyzed: smras pa / yod de /
translated: He said, “Yes, there is.

original: dper na; 'dod pa rnams la 'dod chags dang bral la /🔽gzugs rnams las ni /
analyzed: dper na; 'dod pa rnams la 'dod chags dang bral la / gzugs rnams las ni /
translated: For example, it is like being free from attachment to the sense objects,

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba lta bu'o //
translated: but not being free from attachment to form.

original: ji ltar sna'i sdom pa ma yin pa snga ma bzhin du sbyar ba de bzhin du lce'i sdom pa ma yin pa yang snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar sna'i sdom pa ma yin pa snga ma bzhin du sbyar ba de bzhin du lce'i sdom pa ma yin pa yang snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: Just as the non-restraint of the nose is explained, so too the non-restraint of the tongue should be explained in the same way.

original: yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa ni /
translated: What is non-restraint that is not fully restrained?

original: lnga ste / lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga ste / lnga gang zhe na /
translated: It is fivefold. What are the five?

original: smras pa / sdug bsngal mthong bas @406b spang bar bya ba'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / sdug bsngal mthong bas @406b spang bar bya ba'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: He said, “The non-restraint that is to be abandoned by seeing suffering, and the non-restraint that is to be abandoned by seeing the origin, cessation, path, and by cultivation.

original: yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa ni /
translated: What is non-restraint that is not fully restrained?

original: dgu ste / dgu gang zhe na /
analyzed: dgu ste / dgu gang zhe na /
translated: It is ninefold. What are the nine?

original: smras pa / sdug bsngal la chos shes pas spang bar bya ba'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pas spang bar bya ba dang / kun 'byung ba la chos shes pas spang bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: smras pa / sdug bsngal la chos shes pas spang bar bya ba'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pas spang bar bya ba dang / kun 'byung ba la chos shes pas spang bar bya ba dang /
translated: the unwholesome vows that are to be abandoned by the knowledge of the teaching of the origin of suffering,🔽the unwholesome vows that are to be abandoned by the knowledge of the teaching of the cessation of suffering,

original: kun 'byung ba la rjes su shes pas spang bar bya ba dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pas spang bar bya ba dang / 'gog pa la rjes su shes pas spang bar bya ba dang / lam la chos shes pas spang bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba la rjes su shes pas spang bar bya ba dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pas spang bar bya ba dang / 'gog pa la rjes su shes pas spang bar bya ba dang / lam la chos shes pas spang bar bya ba dang /
translated: the unwholesome vows that are to be abandoned by the knowledge of the teaching of the path,🔽the unwholesome vows that are to be abandoned by the knowledge of the teaching of the path,

original: lam la rjes su shes pas spang bar bya ba dang / sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pas spang bar bya ba dang / sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: and the unwholesome vows that are to be abandoned by meditation.

original: yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa ni /
translated: What are the unwholesome vows?

original: bco lnga ste /
analyzed: bco lnga ste /
translated: They are fifteen.

original: bco lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: bco lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the fifteen?

original: smras pa / 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa lnga dang / gzugs dang mtshungs par ldan pa lnga dang / gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa lnga'o //
analyzed: smras pa / 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa lnga dang / gzugs dang mtshungs par ldan pa lnga dang / gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa lnga'o //
translated: He said, “There are five that are associated with the desire realm, five that are associated with the form realm, and five that are associated with the formless realm.

original: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five that are associated with the desire realm?

original: smras pa / 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa sdug @407a *//
analyzed: smras pa / 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa sdug @407a *//
translated: He said, “The five that are associated with the desire realm are:

original: bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang / 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong ba dang / sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang / 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong ba dang / sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: the lack of restraint that is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, and the lack of restraint that is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of the origin of suffering, by seeing the truth of the cessation of suffering, by seeing the truth of the path, and by cultivation.

original: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as there are five that are associated with the desire realm, there are also five that are associated with the form realm and five that are associated with the formless realm.”

original: yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa ni /
translated: The vows of individual liberation that are not fully restrained

original: dgu bcu rtsa brgyad de /
analyzed: dgu bcu rtsa brgyad de /
translated: are eighty-nine.

original: dgu bcu rtsa brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: dgu bcu rtsa brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eighty-nine?

original: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa sum cu rtsa drug dang / gzugs dang mtshungs par ldan pa sum cu rtsa gcig dang / gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa sum cu rtsa gcig go /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa sum cu rtsa drug dang / gzugs dang mtshungs par ldan pa sum cu rtsa gcig dang / gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa sum cu rtsa gcig go /
translated: They are the thirty-six that are concomitant with the desire realm, the thirty-one that are concomitant with the form realm, and the thirty-one that are concomitant with the formless realm.

original: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa sum cu rtsa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa sum cu rtsa drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the thirty-six that are concomitant with the desire realm?

original: smras pa / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba bcu dang / kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba bdun dang / 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba bdun dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba brgyad dang / sgom pas spang bar bya ba bzhi'o; ;gzugs dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa sum cu rtsa gcig gang zhe na /
analyzed: smras pa / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba bcu dang / kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba bdun dang / 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba bdun dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba brgyad dang / sgom pas spang bar bya ba bzhi'o; ;gzugs dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa sum cu rtsa gcig gang zhe na /
translated: It is said: The thirty-one unmixed unwholesome vows concomitant with form are the ten to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, the seven to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin, the seven to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation, the eight to be abandoned by seeing the truth of path, and the four to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: smras pa / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar @407b bya ba dgu dang / kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba drug dang / 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba drug dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba bdun dang / sgom pas spang bar bya ba gsum mo //
analyzed: smras pa / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar @407b bya ba dgu dang / kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba drug dang / 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba drug dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba bdun dang / sgom pas spang bar bya ba gsum mo //
translated: It is said: The thirty-one unmixed unwholesome vows concomitant with form are the nine to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, the six to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin, the six to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation, the seven to be abandoned by seeing the truth of path, and the three to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: gzugs dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Those associated with the formless realm are similar to those associated with the form realm.

original: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa bcu gang zhe na /🔽smras pa / 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa bcu gang zhe na / smras pa / 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa /
translated: What are the ten unvirtuous actions that are not restrained and are associated with the desire realm?🔽It is said: The afflicted view of the self, extreme view, wrong view, holding a view as paramount,

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
translated: holding ethics and religious rituals as paramount, doubt, desire, hatred, pride, and ignorance that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

original: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven unvirtuous actions that are not restrained and are associated with the desire realm?

original: smras pa / 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang /
analyzed: smras pa / 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang /
translated: It is said that the five views, attachment, anger, pride,🔽ignorance and doubt that are objects abandoned by seeing the truth of origin🔽that is associated with the desire realm are objects abandoned by seeing the🔽truth of origin.

original: ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'o //
translated: It is said: Wrong view, view holding to an extreme, and doubt that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin that is concomitant with desire realm attachment, anger, pride, and ignorance.

original: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa bdun gang zhe na /🔽smras pa / 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar @408a *//
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa bdun gang zhe na / smras pa / 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar @408a *//
translated: What are the seven types of nonrestraint that are concomitant with desire realm?

original: bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
translated: It is said: Wrong view, view holding to an extreme, and doubt that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation that is concomitant with desire realm attachment, anger, pride, and ignorance.

original: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight types of nonrestraint that are concomitant with desire realm?

original: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa la ma mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa la ma mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang /
translated: pride, and ignorance that are associated with the desire realm and are to be abandoned by seeing are the ten.

original: nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o; ;'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o; ;'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four non-restraints that are associated with the desire realm?

original: smras pa / 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
translated: It is said that attachment, anger, pride, and ignorance that are associated with the desire realm and are to be abandoned by cultivation are the four.

original: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang de dang 'dra ste /🔽khong khro ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang de dang 'dra ste / khong khro ba ni /
translated: Just as with those associated with the desire realm, those associated with the form and formless realms are similar.

original: ma gtogs so //
analyzed: ma gtogs so //
translated: Anger is excluded.

original: ci'i phyir 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the afflicted view of the self associated with desire realm objects not a restraint that is not fully restrained?

original: smras pa / kun nas dkris pa'i phyir ni dmigs pa la yang dag par ma bsdams la /
analyzed: smras pa / kun nas dkris pa'i phyir ni dmigs pa la yang dag par ma bsdams la /
translated: It is said: It is not fully restrained with regard to its object because it is a complete entanglement.

original: ma spangs pa'i phyir ni 'dod pa'i khams thams cad la yang @408b dag par ma bsdams pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma spangs pa'i phyir ni 'dod pa'i khams thams cad la yang @408b dag par ma bsdams pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is not fully restrained with regard to the entire desire realm because it is not abandoned.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ji lta ba bzhin du mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ji lta ba bzhin du mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang /
translated: Just as with the afflicted view of the self, so too the extreme view, wrong view that is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, the esteem of morality and asceticism,

original: the tshom dang / ma rig pa kun tu 'gro ba rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: the tshom dang / ma rig pa kun tu 'gro ba rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: doubt, and the two pervasive negative tendencies of ignorance are also like that.

original: ci'i phyir 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called “nonrestraint that is not fully restrained from attachment that is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering in the desire realm”?

original: smras pa / kun nas dkris pa'i phyir ni dmigs pa la yang dag par ma bsdams la /
analyzed: smras pa / kun nas dkris pa'i phyir ni dmigs pa la yang dag par ma bsdams la /
translated: It is said: Because it is fully entangled, it is not fully restrained with regard to the object.

original: ma spangs pa'i phyir ni 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams yang dag par ma bsdams pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma spangs pa'i phyir ni 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams yang dag par ma bsdams pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is not abandoned, it is called “not fully restrained from phenomena that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering in the desire realm.”

original: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags ji lta ba bzhin du khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o; ;thams cad du 'gro ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags ji lta ba bzhin du khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o; ;thams cad du 'gro ba ni /
translated: Just as attachment that is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering in the desire realm is associated with the desire realm, so too are anger, pride, and ignorance.🔽Universal

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ji lta ba bzhin du kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ji lta ba bzhin du kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as the objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering are explained, so too are the objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba ni /
translated: However, the afflicted view of the self and extreme view

original: ma gtogs so //🔽ci'i phyir 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba yang dag par ma @409a *//
analyzed: ma gtogs so // ci'i phyir 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba yang dag par ma @409a *//
translated: are excluded.

original: bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is wrong view concomitant with desire realm objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation called “nonrestraint”?

original: smras pa / kun nas dkris pa'i phyir ni dmigs pa las yang dag par ma bsdams la /
analyzed: smras pa / kun nas dkris pa'i phyir ni dmigs pa las yang dag par ma bsdams la /
translated: It is said: It is nonrestraint due to entanglement with its focal object.

original: ma spangs pa'i phyir ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyis yang dag par ma bsdams pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma spangs pa'i phyir ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyis yang dag par ma bsdams pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is nonrestraint due to not abandoning the dharmas concomitant with it.

original: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba ji lta ba bzhin du the tshom dang / ma rig pa zag pa med pa la dmigs pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba ji lta ba bzhin du the tshom dang / ma rig pa zag pa med pa la dmigs pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as wrong view associated with the realm of desire and to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation is, so too is doubt and ignorance focusing on the uncontaminated.

original: ci'i phyir 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it that the overesteeming of morality and asceticism associated with the realm of desire and to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation is called not fully restrained?

original: smras pa / kun nas dkris pa'i phyir ni dmigs pa la yang dag par ma bsdams la /
analyzed: smras pa / kun nas dkris pa'i phyir ni dmigs pa la yang dag par ma bsdams la /
translated: It is said: It is not fully restrained in relation to its focal object because it is fully bound by it.

original: ma spangs pa'i phyir ni 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams kyis yang dag par ma bsdams pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma spangs pa'i phyir ni 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams kyis yang dag par ma bsdams pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is not fully restrained by the phenomena associated with the realm of desire and to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation because it has not abandoned them.

original: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as the view of holding to an extreme that is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation is concomitant with desire realm, so too are desire, anger, pride, and the afflicted view of mine that focus on contaminated states.

original: 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ji lta ba bzhin du lam mthong bas spang bar bya @409b pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ji lta ba bzhin du lam mthong bas spang bar bya @409b pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as those to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation are concomitant with desire realm, so too are those to be abandoned by seeing the truth of path.

original: tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin par bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin par bstan par bya'o //
translated: However, the view of holding to rules and ritual as supreme should be explained as follows.

original: ci'i phyir 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is desire realm attachment that is to be abandoned by the path of meditation called nonrestraint?

original: smras pa / kun nas dkris pa'i phyir ni dmigs pa la yang dag par ma bsdams la /
analyzed: smras pa / kun nas dkris pa'i phyir ni dmigs pa la yang dag par ma bsdams la /
translated: It is said: It is nonrestraint because it does not restrain the focal object due to being a fetter.

original: ma spangs pa'i phyir ni 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa sgom pas spang par bya ba'i chos rnams kyis yang dag par ma bsdams pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma spangs pa'i phyir ni 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa sgom pas spang par bya ba'i chos rnams kyis yang dag par ma bsdams pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they are not abandoned, those who are not restrained by the path of cultivation that abandons the defilements associated with the realm of desire are called “those who are not restrained.”

original: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags ji lta ba bzhin du khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags ji lta ba bzhin du khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as there is desire associated with the realm of desire that is abandoned by the path of cultivation, so there is anger, pride, and ignorance.

original: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: Just as there are those associated with the realm of desire, so there are those associated with the realms of form and formlessness.

original: las gdags pa tshigs bdun pa'o ////🔽sdom ni / yang dag ma bsdams sdom min ni //
analyzed: las gdags pa tshigs bdun pa'o //// sdom ni / yang dag ma bsdams sdom min ni //
translated: This is the seventh chapter on the presentation of action.

original: sum cu rtsa drug bstan pa ste //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa drug bstan pa ste //
translated: The summary verses: Non-restraint is taught as thirty-six kinds,🔽by way of the realms and by way of the mental factors.

original: khams kyi sgo nas sdom min gsum //
analyzed: khams kyi sgo nas sdom min gsum //
translated: Non-restraint is threefold by way of the realms.

original: sems dang mi ldan drug po las //
analyzed: sems dang mi ldan drug po las //
translated: From among the six mental factors,

original: sdom pa ma yin tha ma rnams //
analyzed: sdom pa ma yin tha ma rnams //
translated: the last non-restraints

original: de bzhin dkar po'i phyogs la yang //
analyzed: de bzhin dkar po'i phyogs la yang //
translated: are like that, and so are the wholesome ones.

original: rgyas pa dag tu sbyar bar bya //
analyzed: rgyas pa dag tu sbyar bar bya //
translated: They are applied in the extensive version.

original: rtsa ba gsum las bzung nas kyang //
analyzed: rtsa ba gsum las bzung nas kyang //
translated: Having taken up the three roots,

original: de yi rjes la dri bar bya //🔽yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa sum cu rtsa @410a *//
analyzed: de yi rjes la dri bar bya // yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa sum cu rtsa @410a *//
translated: one should ask about them afterwards.

original: drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the thirty-six types of non-restraint?

original: smras pa / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba bcu dang / kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba bdun dang / 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba bdun dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba brgyad dang / sgom pas spang bar bya ba bzhi'o //
analyzed: smras pa / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba bcu dang / kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba bdun dang / 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba bdun dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba brgyad dang / sgom pas spang bar bya ba bzhi'o //
translated: It is said: ten to be abandoned by seeing suffering, seven to be abandoned by seeing the origin, seven to be abandoned by seeing cessation, eight to be abandoned by seeing the path, and four to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten types of non-restraint to be abandoned by seeing suffering?

original: smras pa / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang /
translated: He said, “They are the afflicted view of the self, extreme view, wrong view that is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, the esteeming of views, the esteeming of morality and asceticism,

original: the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
translated: doubt, attachment, anger, pride and ignorance.”

original: kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven types of nonrestraint that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin?

original: smras pa / kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
translated: He said, “They are wrong view, the esteeming of views, doubt, attachment, anger, pride and ignorance that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin.”

original: 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o; ;lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa brgyad gang zhe na /🔽smras pa / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba @410b dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang /
analyzed: 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o; ;lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa brgyad gang zhe na / smras pa / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba @410b dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang /
translated: What are the eight forms of non-restraint that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of the path?

original: nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
translated: Wrong view, holding a view as paramount, holding morality and asceticism as paramount, doubt, desire, hatred, pride, and ignorance.

original: sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four forms of non-restraint that are to be abandoned by cultivation?

original: smras pa / sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
translated: Desire, hatred, pride, and ignorance.

original: ci'i phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the afflicted view of the self called non-restraint?

original: smras pa / kun nas dkris pa'i phyir ni dmigs pa yang dag par ma bsdams la /
analyzed: smras pa / kun nas dkris pa'i phyir ni dmigs pa yang dag par ma bsdams la /
translated: He said, “It is because of the envelopment that one is not restrained with regard to the objective mental support.

original: ma spangs pa'i phyir ni 'dod pa'i khams thams cad du yang dag par ma bsdams pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma spangs pa'i phyir ni 'dod pa'i khams thams cad du yang dag par ma bsdams pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is because of the non-abandonment that one is not restrained in all the desire realms.”

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ji lta ba bzhin du mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i ldog par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ji lta ba bzhin du mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i ldog par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang /
translated: Just as with the afflicted view of the self, the extreme view, the afflicted view of holding to an extreme, the view of deprecation, the view of negation, the esteeming of views, and the esteeming of morality and asceticism are also like this.

original: the tshom dang ma rig pa kun tu 'gro ba yang de dang 'dra'o //🔽ci'i phyir sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na; smras pa /
analyzed: the tshom dang ma rig pa kun tu 'gro ba yang de dang 'dra'o // ci'i phyir sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na; smras pa /
translated: Also, the two universal mental afflictions, doubt and ignorance, are also like this.🔽Why is the attachment that is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering called “the non-restraint of one who is not restrained”?

original: kun nas dkris pa'i phyir ni dmigs pa la yang dag par ma bsdams la /
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa'i phyir ni dmigs pa la yang dag par ma bsdams la /
translated: He said, “It is because of the envelopment that one is not restrained with regard to the objective mental support.

original: ma spangs pa'i phyir ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams yang dag par @411a *//
analyzed: ma spangs pa'i phyir ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams yang dag par @411a *//
translated: Because they are not abandoned,🔽the phenomena that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering are not abandoned by the path of seeing the truth of origin.

original: ma bsdams pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma bsdams pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they are not abandoned, the factors that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering are called “not restrained.”

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as there is attachment that is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering,

original: khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: so too there is aversion, pride, and ignorance that are not omnipresent and are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ji lta ba bzhin du kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ji lta ba bzhin du kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as there are factors to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, so too there are factors to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origination.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni /
translated: However, the afflicted view of the self, the extreme view, and the esteeming of morality and asceticism

original: ma gtogs so //
analyzed: ma gtogs so //
translated: are excluded.

original: ci'i phyir 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is wrong view that is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation not called “not restrained”?

original: smras pa / kun nas dkris pa'i phyir ni dmigs pa la yang dag par ma bsdams la; ma spangs pa'i phyir ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyis yang dag par ma bsdams pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / kun nas dkris pa'i phyir ni dmigs pa la yang dag par ma bsdams la; ma spangs pa'i phyir ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyis yang dag par ma bsdams pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He said, “It is because of the fetters that one is not restrained with regard to the object, and because of the non-abandonment that one is not restrained by the dharmas associated with it.

original: 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba ji lta ba bzhin du the tshom dang / ma rig pa zag pa med pa la dmigs pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba ji lta ba bzhin du the tshom dang / ma rig pa zag pa med pa la dmigs pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as wrong view to be abandoned by seeing cessation is not restrained, so too doubt and ignorance focused on the uncontaminated is not restrained.

original: ci'i phyir 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is wrong view grasping at the highest to be abandoned by seeing cessation not a non-restraint?

original: smras pa / kun nas dkris pa'i phyir ni dmigs pa la yang dag par ma bsdams la /
analyzed: smras pa / kun nas dkris pa'i phyir ni dmigs pa la yang dag par ma bsdams la /
translated: He said, “It is because of the fetters that one is not restrained with regard to the object,

original: ma spangs pa'i phyir ni 'gog @411b pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams kyis yang dag par ma bsdams pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma spangs pa'i phyir ni 'gog @411b pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams kyis yang dag par ma bsdams pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and because of the non-abandonment that one is not restrained by the dharmas to be abandoned by seeing cessation.”

original: 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as the overesteeming of morality and ascetic practices is abandoned by insight into the truths of cessation and path, so too are the attachment, repugnance, pride and ignorance that focus on the contaminated.

original: 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ji lta ba bzhin du lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ji lta ba bzhin du lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as the overesteeming of morality and ascetic practices is abandoned by insight into the truths of cessation and path, so too are the attachment, repugnance, pride and ignorance that focus on the contaminated.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa bstan par bya'o //🔽ci'i phyir sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na /🔽kun nas dkris pa'i phyir ni dmigs pa la yang dag par ma bsdams la /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa bstan par bya'o // ci'i phyir sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na / kun nas dkris pa'i phyir ni dmigs pa la yang dag par ma bsdams la /
translated: The overesteeming of morality and ascetic practices should be explained in the same way.🔽Why is attachment that is to be abandoned by the path of cultivation called “nonrestraint”?

original: ma spangs pa'i phyir ni sgom pas spang bar bya ba chos rnams kyis yang dag par ma bsdams pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma spangs pa'i phyir ni sgom pas spang bar bya ba chos rnams kyis yang dag par ma bsdams pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “nonrestraint” because it does not restrain the mind from its object and because it does not abandon the mental factors that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags ji lta ba bzhin du khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags ji lta ba bzhin du khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as there is attachment to be abandoned by the path of cultivation, so too there is anger, pride, and ignorance.

original: yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa gsum yod de /
translated: There are three types of non-restraint that are not fully restrained:

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang / gzugs dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa'o //🔽gang gi 'dod pa @412a *//
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang / gzugs dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa'o // gang gi 'dod pa @412a *//
translated: non-restraint associated with desire realm, non-restraint associated with form realm, and non-restraint associated with formless realm.

original: dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa de'i ni /
analyzed: dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa de'i ni /
translated: For one who has not abandoned and fully understood non-restraint associated with desire realm,

original: gzugs dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa yang ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa yin nam /
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa yang ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa yin nam /
translated: has one also not abandoned and fully understood non-restraint associated with form realm?

original: gzugs dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa gang yin pa de'i ni /
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa gang yin pa de'i ni /
translated: The unvirtuous vows of those who possess form are not abandoned and not fully understood.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa yang ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa ma yin nam zhe na /🔽smras pa / gang gi 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa de'i ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa yang ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa ma yin nam zhe na / smras pa / gang gi 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa de'i ni /
translated: Is it not the case that one who has not abandoned and has not fully understood the unwholesome vows associated with the form realm has also not abandoned and has not fully understood the unwholesome vows associated with the desire realm?

original: gzugs dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma spangs pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang yongs su ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa yin no /
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma spangs pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa dang yongs su ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa yin no /
translated: He replied, “One who has not abandoned and has not fully understood the unwholesome vows associated with the desire realm has also not abandoned and has not fully understood the unwholesome vows associated with the form realm.

original: gzugs dang ldan pa'i yin la 'dod pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa'i yin la 'dod pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa yod dam zhe na /
translated: Is there anyone who has the unwholesome vows associated with the form realm but not the unwholesome vows associated with the desire realm?

original: smras pa / yod de; dper na /
analyzed: smras pa / yod de; dper na /
translated: He replied, “Yes, there is.

original: 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang bral la /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang bral la /
translated: For example, someone who is free from attachment to the desires of the desire realm

original: gzugs rnams la 'dod chags dang bral ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzugs rnams la 'dod chags dang bral ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, one who is free from attachment to the form realm.

original: gang gi 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa de'i ni /
analyzed: gang gi 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa de'i ni /
translated: If one has not abandoned and has not fully understood the unwholesome vows that are associated with the desire realm,

original: gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa yang ma spangs @412b shing yongs su ma shes pa yin nam /
analyzed: gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa yang ma spangs @412b shing yongs su ma shes pa yin nam /
translated: has one also not abandoned and not fully understood the unwholesome vows that are associated with the formless realm?

original: gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa gang yin pa de'i ni /
analyzed: gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa gang yin pa de'i ni /
translated: If one has not abandoned and has not fully understood the unwholesome vows that are associated with the formless realm,

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa yang ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa yang ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: has one also not abandoned and not fully understood the unwholesome vows that are associated with the desire realm?

original: smras pa / gang gi 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa de'i ni /
analyzed: smras pa / gang gi 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa de'i ni /
translated: He said, “If one has not abandoned and has not fully understood the unwholesome vows that are associated with the desire realm,

original: gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa yang ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa yang ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa yin no //
translated: One who has not abandoned and has not fully understood the unwholesome non-restraint associated with the formless realm.

original: gzugs med pa dang ldan la 'dod pa dang mi ldan pa yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs med pa dang ldan la 'dod pa dang mi ldan pa yod dam zhe na /
translated: Can one possess the formless realm and not possess the desire realm?

original: smras pa / yod de /
analyzed: smras pa / yod de /
translated: It is said: Yes.

original: dper na / 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang bral ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na / 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang bral ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, one who is free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: gang gi gzugs dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa gang yin pa de'i ni /
analyzed: gang gi gzugs dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa gang yin pa de'i ni /
translated: One who has not abandoned and has not fully understood the unwholesome non-restraint associated with the form realm,

original: gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa yang ma spangs shing yongs su shes pa yin nam /
analyzed: gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa yang ma spangs shing yongs su shes pa yin nam /
translated: does he also not abandon and not fully understand the unwholesome non-restraint associated with the formless realm?

original: gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa de'i ni /
analyzed: gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i yang dag par ma bsdams pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa de'i ni /
translated: One who has not abandoned and has not fully understood the unwholesome non-restraint associated with the formless realm,
